 23739                                  ; TCODE4.ASM, MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3), 1983 (& 1987)
 23740                                  ;============================================================================
 23741                                  ; 05/10/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 23742                                  
 23743                                  ; DATE - Gets and sets the time
 23744                                  
 23745                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 20C0h
 23746                                  
 23747                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 23748                                  
 23749                                  DATE_CXDX:
 23750                                  	mov	bx,cx
 23751                                  
 23752                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 23753                                  
 23754                                  P_DATE:
 23755                                  	mov	ax,bx
 23756                                  	mov	cx,dx
 23757                                  	mov	dl,100
 23758                                  	div	dl
 23759                                  	xchg	al,ah
 23760                                  	xchg	ax,dx
 23761                                  	mov	bh,'0'-' ' ; 10h  ; Enable leading zero suppression
 23762                                  	;mov	ax,[INTERNATVARS]
 23763                                  	mov	ax,[INTERNATVARS+INTERNAT_BLOCK.Date_tim_format]
 23764                                  	or	ax,ax
 23765                                  	jz	short USPDAT
 23766                                  	dec	ax
 23767                                  	jz	short EUPDAT
 23768                                  	mov	bh,0	 ; Disable leading zero suppression	
 23769                                  	call	P_YR
 23770                                  	call	P_DSEP
 23771                                  	call	P_MON
 23772                                  	call	P_DSEP
 23773                                  	call	P_DAY
 23774                                  	retn
 23775                                  
 23776                                  USPDAT:
 23777                                  	call	P_MON
 23778                                  	call	P_DSEP
 23779                                  	call	P_DAY
 23780                                  PLST:
 23781                                  	call	P_DSEP
 23782                                  	call	P_YR
 23783                                  	retn
 23784                                  
 23785                                  EUPDAT:
 23786                                  	call	P_DAY
 23787                                  	call	P_DSEP
 23788                                  	call	P_MON
 23789                                  	jmp	short PLST
 23790                                  
 23791                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23792                                  
 23793                                  P_MON:
 23794                                  	mov	al,ch
 23795                                  	call	OUT2
 23796                                  	retn
 23797                                  
 23798                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23799                                  
 23800                                  P_DSEP:
 23801                                  	;mov	al,[DATE_SEP] ; INTERNATVARS+11
 23802                                  	mov	al,[INTERNATVARS+INTERNAT_BLOCK.Date_sep]
 23803                                  	stosb
 23804                                  	retn
 23805                                  
 23806                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23807                                  
 23808                                  P_DAY:
 23809                                  	mov	al,cl
 23810                                  	call	OUT2
 23811                                  	retn
 23812                                  
 23813                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23814                                  
 23815                                  P_YR:
 23816                                  	mov	al,dh
 23817                                  	or	al,al
 23818                                  	jz	short TWODIGYR	; Two instead of 4 digit year
 23819                                  	call	OUT2
 23820                                  TWODIGYR:
 23821                                  	mov	al,dl
 23822                                  	call	OUT2
 23823                                  DATE_RETN:
 23824                                  	retn
 23825                                  
 23826                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 23827                                  
 23828                                  DATE:				 ; Accepting argument for date inline
 23829                                  	mov	si,81h
 23830                                  	call	SCANOFF
 23831                                  	cmp	al,0Dh
 23832                                  	jz	short PRMTDAT
 23833                                  	jmp	short COMDAT
 23834                                  
 23835                                  	;nop
 23836                                  PRMTDAT:
 23837                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 23838                                  	mov	dx,CURDATPTR
 23839                                  	call	STD_PRINTF	; Print "Current date is "	
 23840                                  	call	PRINT_DATE
 23841                                  GETDAT:	
 23842                                  	mov	dx,NEWDATPTR
 23843                                  	call	STD_PRINTF	 ; Print "Enter new date: "
 23844                                  
 23845                                  	mov	ax,INTERNATIONAL*256 ; 3800h 
 23846                                  				; Determine what format the date
 23847                                  	mov	dx,5Ch		;  should be entered in and
 23848                                  	int	21h	; DOS -	2+ - GET COUNTRY-DEPENDENT INFORMATION
 23849                                  			; get current-country info
 23850                                  			; DS:DX	-> buffer for returned info
 23851                                  	mov	si,dx		;  print a message describing it
 23852                                  	lodsw
 23853                                  	mov	dx,USADATPTR	; get mm-dd-yy
 23854                                  	dec	ax
 23855                                  	js	short PRINTFORMAT
 23856                                  	mov	dx,EURDATPTR	; get dd-mm-yy
 23857                                  	jz	short PRINTFORMAT
 23858                                  	mov	dx,JAPDATPTR	; get yy-mm-dd
 23859                                  PRINTFORMAT:
 23860                                  	call	STD_PRINTF
 23861                                  	mov	ah,Std_Con_String_Input	; 0Ah
 23862                                  	mov	dx,COMBUF
 23863                                  	mov	cx,INITSPECIAL ;2 ; Set bit in InitFlag that indicate
 23864                                  	call	SETINITFLAG	;  prompting for date.
 23865                                  	int	21h		; Get input line
 23866                                  	xor	cx,cx		; Reset bit in InitFlag that indicates
 23867                                  	call	SETINITFLAG	;  prompting for date.
 23868                                  	call	CRLF2
 23869                                  	mov	si,COMBUF+2
 23870                                  	cmp	byte [si],0Dh
 23871                                  	jz	short DATE_RETN
 23872                                  COMDAT:
 23873                                  	;mov	ax,[INTERNATVARS]
 23874                                  	mov	ax,[INTERNATVARS+INTERNAT_BLOCK.Date_tim_format]
 23875                                  	or	ax,ax
 23876                                  	jz	short USSDAT
 23877                                  	dec	ax
 23878                                  	jz	short EUSDAT
 23879                                  	call	GET_YR
 23880                                  	jc	short DATERRJ
 23881                                  	call	GET_DSEP
 23882                                  	jc	short DATERRJ
 23883                                  	call	GET_MON
 23884                                  	jc	short DATERRJ
 23885                                  	call	GET_DSEP
 23886                                  	jc	short DATERRJ
 23887                                  	call	GET_DAY
 23888                                  DAT_SET:
 23889                                  	jnc	short DATSET
 23890                                  	jmp	DATERR
 23891                                  
 23892                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23893                                  
 23894                                  DATSET:
 23895                                  	lodsb
 23896                                  	cmp	al,' '
 23897                                  	jz	short DATSET
 23898                                  	cmp	al,9
 23899                                  	jz	short DATSET
 23900                                  	cmp	al,0Dh
 23901                                  	jnz	short DATERR
 23902                                  	mov	ah,SET_DATE ; 2Bh
 23903                                  	int	21h	; DOS -	SET CURRENT DATE
 23904                                  			; DL = day,DH = month,	CX = year
 23905                                  			; Return: AL = 00h if no error 
 23906                                  			; 	     = FFh if bad value sent to routine
 23907                                  	or	al,al
 23908                                  	jnz	short DATERR
 23909                                  DAT_SET_RETN:
 23910                                  	retn
 23911                                  
 23912                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23913                                  
 23914                                  USSDAT:
 23915                                  	call	GET_MON
 23916                                  	jb	short DATERR
 23917                                  	call	GET_DSEP
 23918                                  DATERRJ:
 23919                                  	jc	short DATERR
 23920                                  	call	GET_DAY
 23921                                  TGET:
 23922                                  	jc	short DATERR
 23923                                  	call	GET_DSEP
 23924                                  	jc	short DATERR
 23925                                  	call	GET_YR
 23926                                  	jmp	short DAT_SET
 23927                                  
 23928                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23929                                  
 23930                                  EUSDAT:
 23931                                  	call	GET_DAY
 23932                                  	jc	short DATERR
 23933                                  	call	GET_DSEP
 23934                                  	jc	short DATERR
 23935                                  	call	GET_MON
 23936                                  	jmp	short TGET
 23937                                  
 23938                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 23939                                  
 23940                                  GET_MON:
 23941                                  	call	GETNUM		; Get one or two digit number
 23942                                  	jc	short DAT_SET_RETN
 23943                                  	mov	dh,ah		; Put in position
 23944                                  	retn
 23945                                  
 23946                                  
 23947                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 23948                                  
 23949                                  GET_DAY:
 23950                                  		call	GETNUM
 23951                                  		mov	dl,ah		; Put in position
 23952                                  GET_DAY_RETN:
 23953                                  		retn
 23954                                  
 23955                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 23956                                  
 23957                                  GET_YR:
 23958                                  	call	GETNUM
 23959                                  	jc	short GET_DAY_RETN
 23960                                  	mov	cx,1900
 23961                                  	call	GET_DSEP
 23962                                  	pushf
 23963                                  	dec	si
 23964                                  	popf
 23965                                  	jz	short BIAS
 23966                                  	cmp	byte [si],0Dh
 23967                                  	je	short BIAS
 23968                                  	cmp	byte [si],' '
 23969                                  	je	short BIAS
 23970                                  	cmp	byte [si],9
 23971                                  	je	short BIAS
 23972                                  	push	bx
 23973                                  	mov	bl,100
 23974                                  	mov	al,ah
 23975                                  	mul	bl
 23976                                  	pop	bx
 23977                                  	mov	cx,ax
 23978                                  	call	GETNUM
 23979                                  	jc	short GET_DAY_RETN
 23980                                  BIAS:
 23981                                  	mov	al,ah
 23982                                  	mov	ah,0
 23983                                  	add	cx,ax
 23984                                  BIAS_RETN:
 23985                                  	retn
 23986                                  
 23987                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23988                                  
 23989                                  DATERR:
 23990                                  	mov	dx,BADDATPTR
 23991                                  	call	STD_PRINTF
 23992                                  	jmp	GETDAT
 23993                                  
 23994                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 23995                                  
 23996                                  GET_DSEP:
 23997                                  	lodsb
 23998                                  	cmp	al,'/'
 23999                                  	je	short BIAS_RETN
 24000                                  	;cmp	al,'.'
 24001                                  	cmp	al,[DOT_CHR]
 24002                                  	je	short BIAS_RETN
 24003                                  	;cmp	al,'-'
 24004                                  	cmp	al,[CHAR_SUB]
 24005                                  	je	short BIAS_RETN
 24006                                  	stc
 24007                                  	retn
 24008                                  
 24009                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 24010                                  
 24011                                  ; TIME gets and sets the time
 24012                                  
 24013                                  CTIME:
 24014                                  	mov	si,81h		; Accepting argument for time inline
 24015                                  	call	SCANOFF
 24016                                  	cmp	al,0Dh
 24017                                  	je	short PRMTTIM
 24018                                  	mov	bx,2E3Ah ; ":."
 24019                                  	call	INLINE
 24020                                  	jmp	COMTIM
 24021                                  
 24022                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 24023                                  
 24024                                  PRINT_TIME:
 24025                                  	mov	ah,Get_Time ; 2Ch ; Get time in CX:DX
 24026                                  	int	21h	; DOS -	GET CURRENT TIME
 24027                                  			; Return: CH = hours,CL = minutes,DH = seconds
 24028                                  			; DL = hundredths of seconds
 24029                                  	push	di
 24030                                  	push	es
 24031                                  	push	cs
 24032                                  	pop	es
 24033                                  	mov	di,CHARBUF
 24034                                  	mov	bl,1	; Always 24 hour time
 24035                                  	call	P_TIME
 24036                                  	xor	ax,ax
 24037                                  	stosb
 24038                                  	mov	dx,CHARBUF
 24039                                  	mov	[STRING_PTR_2],dx
 24040                                  	mov	dx,STRINGBUF2PTR
 24041                                  	call	STD_PRINTF
 24042                                  	pop	es
 24043                                  	pop	di
 24044                                  P_TIME_RETN:
 24045                                  	retn
 24046                                  
 24047                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 24048                                  
 24049                                  P_TIME:
 24050                                  	mov	al,ch	
 24051                                  	test	bl,7Fh		; Ignore high bit
 24052                                  	jnz	short T24	; 24 hr time?
 24053                                  	mov	bh,'a'		; Assume A.M.
 24054                                  	cmp	al,12		; In the afternoon?
 24055                                  	jb	short MORN
 24056                                  	mov	bh,'p'
 24057                                  	jz	short MORN
 24058                                  	sub	al,12		; Keep it to 12 hours or less
 24059                                  MORN:
 24060                                  	or	al,al		; Before 1 am?
 24061                                  	jnz	short T24
 24062                                  	mov	al,12
 24063                                  T24:
 24064                                  	push	bx
 24065                                  	mov	bh,'0'-' ' ; 10h ; Enable leading zero suppression
 24066                                  	call	OUT2
 24067                                  	call	P_TSEP
 24068                                  	mov	al,cl
 24069                                  	call	OUT2
 24070                                  	pop	bx
 24071                                  	push	bx
 24072                                  	test	bl,80h
 24073                                  	jnz	short PAP	; If from DIR, go directly to am pm
 24074                                  	mov	bh,0		; Disable leading zero suppression
 24075                                  	call	P_TSEP
 24076                                  	mov	al,dh
 24077                                  	call	OUT2
 24078                                  	;mov	al,'.'
 24079                                  	mov	al,[DECIMAL_SEP]
 24080                                  	stosb
 24081                                  	mov	al,dl
 24082                                  	call	OUT2
 24083                                  PAP:
 24084                                  	pop	bx
 24085                                  	test	bl,7Fh		; Ignore high bit
 24086                                  	jnz	short P_TIME_RETN
 24087                                  	mov	al,bh
 24088                                  	stosb
 24089                                  	retn
 24090                                  
 24091                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 24092                                  
 24093                                  P_TSEP:
 24094                                  	;mov	al,[TIME_SEP]
 24095                                  	mov	al,[INTERNATVARS+INTERNAT_BLOCK.Time_sep]
 24096                                  	stosb
 24097                                  P_TSEP_RETN:
 24098                                  	retn
 24099                                  
 24100                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24101                                  
 24102                                  PRMTTIM:
 24103                                  	mov	dx,CURTIMPTR
 24104                                  	call	STD_PRINTF	; Print "Current time is "
 24105                                  	call	PRINT_TIME
 24106                                  GETTIM:
 24107                                  	xor	cx,cx		; Initialize hours and minutes to zero
 24108                                  	mov	dx,NEWTIMPTR
 24109                                  	call	STD_PRINTF
 24110                                  	;mov	bx,':.'
 24111                                  	mov	bx,[TIMECHARS] 
 24112                                  	call	GETBUF
 24113                                  COMTIM:
 24114                                  	jz	short P_TSEP_RETN ; If no time present, don't change it	
 24115                                  	jc	short TIMEERR
 24116                                  	mov	cx,dx
 24117                                  	xor	dx,dx
 24118                                  	lodsb
 24119                                  	cmp	al,0Dh
 24120                                  	je	short SAVTIM
 24121                                  	cmp	al,' '
 24122                                  	je	short GOTSEC2
 24123                                  	cmp	al,9
 24124                                  	je	short GOTSEC2
 24125                                  	cmp	al,bl
 24126                                  	je	short GOTSEC
 24127                                  	cmp	al,bh
 24128                                  	jne	short TIMEERR
 24129                                  GOTSEC:
 24130                                  	call	GETNUM
 24131                                  	jc	short TIMEERR
 24132                                  	mov	dh,ah		; Position seconds
 24133                                  	lodsb
 24134                                  	cmp	al,0Dh
 24135                                  	je	short SAVTIM
 24136                                  	cmp	al,' '
 24137                                  	je	short GOTSEC2
 24138                                  	cmp	al,9
 24139                                  	je	short GOTSEC2
 24140                                  	;cmp	al,'.'
 24141                                  	cmp	al,[DECIMAL_SEP]
 24142                                  	jne	short TIMEERR
 24143                                  	call	GETNUM
 24144                                  	jc	short TIMEERR
 24145                                  	mov	dl,ah
 24146                                  GOTSEC2:
 24147                                  	lodsb
 24148                                  	cmp	al,' '
 24149                                  	je	short GOTSEC2
 24150                                  	cmp	al,9
 24151                                  	je	short GOTSEC2
 24152                                  	cmp	al,0Dh
 24153                                  	jne	short TIMEERR
 24154                                  SAVTIM:
 24155                                  	mov	ah,SET_TIME ; 2Dh
 24156                                  	int	21h	; DOS -	SET CURRENT TIME
 24157                                  			; CH = hours,CL = minutes,DH = seconds,
 24158                                  			;		DL = hundredths of seconds
 24159                                  			; Return: AL = 00h if no error 
 24160                                  			;	     = FFh if bad value sent to routine
 24161                                  	or	al,al
 24162                                  P_TSEP_JRETN:
 24163                                  	jz	short P_TSEP_RETN ; Error in time?
 24164                                  TIMEERR:
 24165                                  	mov	dx,BADTIMPTR
 24166                                  	call	STD_PRINTF	; Print "Enter new time: "
 24167                                  	jmp	short GETTIM
 24168                                  
 24169                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 24170                                  
 24171                                  GETBUF:
 24172                                  	mov	ah,Std_Con_String_Input ; 0Ah
 24173                                  	mov	dx,COMBUF
 24174                                  	mov	cx,2
 24175                                  	call	SETINITFLAG
 24176                                  	int	21h		; Get input line
 24177                                  	xor	cx,cx
 24178                                  	call	SETINITFLAG
 24179                                  	call	CRLF2
 24180                                  	mov	si,COMBUF+2
 24181                                  	cmp	byte [si],0Dh	; Check if new time entered
 24182                                  	jz	short P_TSEP_JRETN
 24183                                  
 24184                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 24185                                  
 24186                                  INLINE:
 24187                                  	call	GETNUM		; Get one or two digit number
 24188                                  	jnb	short INLINE1
 24189                                  	retn
 24190                                  INLINE1:
 24191                                  	mov	dh,ah		; Put in position
 24192                                  	lodsb
 24193                                  	cmp	al,bl
 24194                                  	jz	short NEXT
 24195                                  	cmp	al,bh
 24196                                  	jz	short NEXT
 24197                                  	dec	si		; Clears zero flag
 24198                                  	clc
 24199                                  	mov	dl,0
 24200                                  	retn			; Time may have only an hour specified
 24201                                  NEXT:
 24202                                  	call	GETNUM
 24203                                  	mov	dl,ah		; Put in position
 24204                                  INLINE_RETN:
 24205                                  	retn
 24206                                  
 24207                                  ;============================================================================
 24208                                  ; TCODE5.ASM, MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3), 1983 (& 1987)
 24209                                  ;============================================================================
 24210                                  ; 05/10/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 24211                                  
 24212                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 2370h
 24213                                  
 24214                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 24215                                  
 24216                                  GETNUM:
 24217                                  	call	INDIG
 24218                                  	jb	short INLINE_RETN
 24219                                  	mov	ah,al		; Save first digit
 24220                                  	call	INDIG		; Another digit?
 24221                                  	jb	short OKRET
 24222                                  	aad			; Convert unpacked BCD to decimal
 24223                                  	mov	ah,al
 24224                                  OKRET:
 24225                                  	or	al,1
 24226                                  GETNUM_RETN:
 24227                                  	retn
 24228                                  
 24229                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 24230                                  
 24231                                  INDIG:
 24232                                  	mov	al,[si]
 24233                                  	sub	al,'0'
 24234                                  	jc	short GETNUM_RETN
 24235                                  	cmp	al,10
 24236                                  	cmc
 24237                                  	jc	short GETNUM_RETN
 24238                                  	inc	si
 24239                                  	retn
 24240                                  
 24241                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 24242                                  
 24243                                  OUT2:				; Output binary number as two ASCII digits
 24244                                  	aam			; Convert binary to unpacked BCD
 24245                                  	xchg	al,ah
 24246                                  	or	ax,3030h	; Add "0" bias to both digits
 24247                                  	cmp	al,'0'		; Is MSD zero?
 24248                                  	jnz	short NOSUP
 24249                                  	sub	al,bh		; Suppress leading zero if enabled
 24250                                  NOSUP:
 24251                                  	mov	bh,0		; Disable zero suppression
 24252                                  	stosw
 24253                                  	retn
 24254                                  
 24255                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24256                                  	;stosb
 24257                                  	;retn
 24258                                  
 24259                                  ;============================================================================
 24260                                  ; TPIPE.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 24261                                  ;============================================================================
 24262                                  ; 03/10/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 24263                                  
 24264                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 23A3h
 24265                                  
 24266                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 24267                                  
 24268                                  ; Set the special flag in the INIT flag to the value in CX.
 24269                                  
 24270                                  SETINITFLAG:
 24271                                  	mov	ds,[RESSEG]
 24272                                  	;and	byte [INITFLAG],0FDh
 24273                                  	and	byte [INITFLAG],~INITSPECIAL
 24274                                  	or	byte [INITFLAG],cl
 24275                                  	push	cs
 24276                                  	pop	ds
 24277                                  	retn
 24278                                  
 24279                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 24280                                  
 24281                                  PIPEOFF:
 24282                                  	push	ds
 24283                                  	push	ax
 24284                                  	mov	ds,[cs:RESSEG]
 24285                                  	xor	al,al
 24286                                  	xchg	al,byte [PIPEFLAG]
 24287                                  	or	al,al
 24288                                  	jz	short PIPEOFFDONE
 24289                                  	shr	byte [ECHOFLAG],1
 24290                                  PIPEOFFDONE:
 24291                                  	pop	ax
 24292                                  	pop	ds
 24293                                  	retn
 24294                                  
 24295                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24296                                  	;db    0,0,0,0,0
 24297                                  	;times 5 db 0
 24298                                  
 24299                                  align 16
 24300                                  
 24301                                  %endif
 24302                                  
 24303                                  ;============================================================================
 24304                                  ; PARSE2.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 24305                                  ;============================================================================
 24306                                  ; 03/10/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 24307                                  
 24308                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24309                                  ; PARSELINE takes an MSDOS command line and maps it into a UNIX-style
 24310                                  ; argv[argvcnt] array. The most important difference between this array and
 24311                                  ; the tradition UNIX format is the extra cparse information included with
 24312                                  ; each argument element.
 24313                                  ;---------------
 24314                                  ; ENTRY:
 24315                                  ;	BL	     special delimiter for cparse -- not implemented)
 24316                                  ;---------------
 24317                                  ; EXIT:
 24318                                  ;	CF	    set if error
 24319                                  ;	AL	    error code (carry set). Note AH clobbered in any event.
 24320                                  ;	argv[]	    array of cparse flags and pointers to arguments
 24321                                  ;	argvcnt     argument count
 24322                                  ;---------------
 24323                                  ; NOTE(S):
 24324                                  ;	*   BL (special delimiter) is ignored, for now (set to space).
 24325                                  ;	*   Parseflags record contains cparse flags, as follows:
 24326                                  ;		sw_flag 	--	was this arg a switch?
 24327                                  ;		wildcard	--	whether or not it contained a * or ?
 24328                                  ;		path_sep	--	maybe it was a pathname
 24329                                  ;		unused		--	for future expansion
 24330                                  ;		special_delim	--	was there an initial special delimiter?
 24331                                  ;	*   argv[] and argvcnt are undefined if CF/AL indicates an error.
 24332                                  ;	*   Relationship between input, cparse output, and comtail can be
 24333                                  ;	    found in the following chart. Despite the claim of the cparse
 24334                                  ;	    documentation that, "Token buffer always starts d: for non switch
 24335                                  ;	    tokens", such is not the case (see column two, row two).
 24336                                  ;	    Similarly, [STARTEL] is not null when the command line is one of
 24337                                  ;	    the forms, "d:", "d:\", or "d:/". In fact, *STARTEL (i.e., what
 24338                                  ;	    STARTEL addresses) will be null. This is clearly just a
 24339                                  ;	    documentation error.
 24340                                  ;	*   cparse also returns a switch code in BP for each switch it
 24341                                  ;	    recognizes on the command line.
 24342                                  ;	*   arglen for each token does NOT include the terminating null.
 24343                                  ;	*   Finally, note that interesting constructions like 'foodir/*.exe'
 24344                                  ;	    parse as three separate tokens, and the asterisk is NOT a wildcard.
 24345                                  ;	    For example, 'for %i in (foodir/*.exe) do echo %i' will first
 24346                                  ;	    echo 'foodir', then '*', then '.exe'. Using cparse for command-
 24347                                  ;	    line parsing may result in slightly different behavior than
 24348                                  ;	    previously observed with the old COMMAND.COM command-line parser.
 24349                                  ;
 24350                                  ;	    Input		    Cparse		Command Line (80H)
 24351                                  ;	\alan\foo.bat		c:\alan\foo.bat 	\alan\foo.bat
 24352                                  ;	alan\foo.bat		alan\foo.bat		alan\foo.bat
 24353                                  ;	foo.bat 		foo.bat 		foo.bat
 24354                                  ;	c:\alan\foo.bat 	c:\alan\foo.bat 	c:\alan\foo.bat
 24355                                  ;	c:alan\foo.bat		c:alan\foo.bat		c:alan\foo.bat
 24356                                  ;	c:foo.bat		c:foo.bat		c:foo.bat
 24357                                  
 24358                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 24359                                  
 24360                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 23D0h
 24361                                  
 24362                                  ; 01/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 24363                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 319Bh
 24364                                  
 24365                                  ; 12/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 24366                                  ; MSDOS 6.22 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 3745h
 24367                                  
 24368                                  ; 27/07/2024 - Retro DOS v4.0-v4.1-v4.2-v5.0 COMMAND.COM (PARSELINE)
 24369                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 35F5h
 24370                                  
 24371                                  PARSELINE:
 24372 00003037 50                      	push	ax			; most of these are clobbered
 24373 00003038 53                      	push	bx			; by cparse...
 24374 00003039 51                      	push	cx
 24375 0000303A 52                      	push	dx
 24376 0000303B 57                      	push	di
 24377 0000303C 56                      	push	si
 24378 0000303D 9C                      	pushf
 24379                                  	;mov	byte [cpyflag],0  ; Turn "CPARSE called from COPY flag" off
 24380 0000303E C706[9A93]FFFF          	mov	word [LASTARG],-1 ; last argument at which to accumulate
 24381 00003044 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 24382                                  	;;mov	cx,1348
 24383                                  	; 27/07/2024
 24384                                  	;mov	cx,1092  ; PCDOS 7.1 COMMAND.COM
 24385 00003046 B94404                  	mov	cx,ARG_UNIT.SIZE ; 1092
 24386 00003049 A2[398C]                	mov	[cpyflag],al ; 0 ; 27/07/2024
 24387 0000304C BF[D48D]                	mov	di,ARG
 24388 0000304F F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 24389                                  	;mov	word [ARGBUF_PTR],ARG_ARGBUF
 24390 00003051 C706[1893][9890]        	mov	word [ARGBUF_PTR],ARG+ARG_UNIT.argbuf
 24391                                  	;mov	word [ARG_ARGSWINFO],0 ; switch information, and info to date
 24392                                  	;mov	word [ARG+ARG_UNIT.argswinfo],0
 24393 00003057 A3[9690]                	mov	[ARG+ARG_UNIT.argswinfo],ax ; 0 ; 27/07/2024
 24394                                  	;mov	word [ARG_ARGVCNT],0 ; initialize argvcnt/argv[]
 24395                                  	;mov	word [ARG+ARG_UNIT.argvcnt],0
 24396 0000305A A3[9490]                	mov	[ARG+ARG_UNIT.argvcnt],ax ; 0 ; 27/07/2024 
 24397 0000305D BE[2689]                	mov	si,COMBUF+2	; prescan leaves cooked input in combuf
 24398                                  
 24399                                  ; This next section of code (up to pcont:)  makes sure that si is set up for
 24400                                  ; parsing. It should point at COMBUF if FORFLAG is set and arg.argforcombuf
 24401                                  ; otherwise. This is done so that commands can get arg pointers into their
 24402                                  ; original command line (or an exact copy of it) in arg_ocomptr.
 24403                                  ; Arg.argforcombuf is used so that the for loop processor will always be able
 24404                                  ; to get a hold of its original command line; even after COMBUF is blasted by
 24405                                  ; the command to be repeated or the transient part of command has been
 24406                                  ; reloaded.
 24407                                  
 24408 00003060 1E                      	push	ds
 24409 00003061 8E1E[C58A]              	mov	ds,[RESSEG]
 24410                                  	;cmp	byte [ForFlag],0
 24411 00003065 3806[9401]              	cmp	[ForFlag],al ; 0 ; 27/07/2024
 24412 00003069 1F                      	pop	ds
 24413 0000306A 7510                    	jnz	short PCONT
 24414                                  	;mov	di,ARG_ARGFORCOMBUF
 24415 0000306C BF[9891]                	mov	di,ARG+ARG_UNIT.argforcombuf
 24416 0000306F 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 24417 00003071 8A0E[2589]              	mov	cl,[COMBUF+1]
 24418 00003075 FEC1                    	inc	cl
 24419 00003077 F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 24420                                  	;mov	si,ARG_ARGFORCOMBUF
 24421 00003079 BE[9891]                	mov	si,ARG+ARG_UNIT.argforcombuf
 24422                                  PCONT:
 24423 0000307C BF[1A93]                	mov	di,TPBUF	; destination is temporary token buffer
 24424 0000307F B320                    	mov	bl,' '		; no special delimiter, for now
 24425                                  PARSELOOP:
 24426 00003081 8936[9C93]              	mov	[COMPTR],si	; save ptr into original command buffer
 24427 00003085 31ED                    	xor	bp,bp		; switch information put here by cparse
 24428 00003087 C606[B68D]00            	mov	byte [expand_star],0 ; don't expand *'s to ?'s
 24429 0000308C E84FF5                  	call	scanoff		; skip leading blanks...

 24435                                  				;   typical cause of this is that a
 24436                                  				;   switch char IMMEDIATELY preceeds
 24437                                  				;   the CR. We have an argument, but it
 24438                                  				;   is sort of an error.

 24451                                  	;jmp	short PARSE_ERROR ; NO, it wasn't -- bug out (CF set)

 24470                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 24471                                  
 24472                                  ; NEWARG adds the supplied argstring and cparse data to arg.argv[].
 24473                                  ;
 24474                                  ; ENTRY:
 24475                                  ;   BH			argflags
 24476                                  ;   CX			character count in argstring
 24477                                  ;   DI			pointer to argstring
 24478                                  ;   comptr		ptr to starting loc of current token in original command
 24479                                  ;   [STARTEL]		cparse's answer to where the last element starts
 24480                                  ; EXIT:
 24481                                  ;   argbufptr		points to next free section of argbuffer
 24482                                  ;   arg.argbuf		contains null-terminated argument strings
 24483                                  ;   arg.argvcnt 	argument count
 24484                                  ;   arg.argv[]		array of flags and pointers
 24485                                  ;   arg.arg_ocomptr	ptr to starting loc of current token in original command
 24486                                  ;   CF			set if error
 24487                                  ;   AL			carry set:  error code; otherwise, zero
 24488                                  
 24489                                  	; 01/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 24490                                  	; 12/06/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 COMMAND.COM
 24491                                  	; 27/07/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM 
 24492                                  	;	     & Retro DOS v4.1 COMMAND.COM (2024 modification)

 24499 000030B7 9C                      	pushf
 24500 000030B8 E86200                  	call	arg_switch		; if it's a switch, record switch info
 24501                                  					; LEAVE SWITCH ON COMMAND LINE!!

 24503                                  
 24504                                  	;cmp	word [ARG_ARGVCNT],64	; check to ensure we've not
 24505 000030BB 833E[9490]40            	cmp	word [ARG+ARG_UNIT.argvcnt],ARGMAX ; 64
 24506 000030C0 7D50                    	jge	short to_many_args	; exceeded array limits
 24507 000030C2 88FE                    	mov	dh,bh			
 24508                                  	;mov	bx,[ARG_ARGVCNT]	; save argflags	
 24509 000030C4 8B1E[9490]              	mov	bx,[ARG+ARG_UNIT.argvcnt] ; argv[argvcnt++] = arg data
 24510                                  	;inc	word [ARG_ARGVCNT]
 24511 000030C8 FF06[9490]              	inc	word [ARG+ARG_UNIT.argvcnt]
 24512                                  	;mov	ax,ARG_ARGV
 24513 000030CC B8[D48D]                	mov	ax,ARG+ARG_UNIT.argv
 24514 000030CF E87E00                  	call	argv_calc		; convert offset to pointer
 24515                                  	;mov	[BX].argsw_word,0 	; no switch information, yet...
 24516                                  	;mov	word [bx+7],0
 24517 000030D2 C747070000              	mov	word [bx+ARGV_ELE.argsw_word],0
 24518                                  	;mov	[BX].arglen,CX		; argv[argvcnt].arglen = arg length
 24519                                  	;mov	[bx+5],cx

 24521                                  	;mov	[BX].argflags,DH 	; argv[argvcnt].argflags = cparse flags
 24522                                  	;mov	[bx+2],dh
 24523 000030DA 887702                  	mov	[bx+ARGV_ELE.argflags],dh
 24524 000030DD 8B36[1893]              	mov	si,[ARGBUF_PTR]
 24525                                  	;mov	[BX].argpointer,SI 	; argv[argvcnt].argpointer = [argbufptr]
 24526                                  	;mov	[bx+ARGV_ELE.argpointer],si
 24527 000030E1 8937                    	mov	[bx],si			
 24528 000030E3 0336[7B8D]              	add	si,[STARTEL]		; save startel from new location
 24529 000030E7 29FE                    	sub	si,di			; form pointer into argbuf
 24530                                  	;mov	[BX].argstartel,SI ; argv[argvcnt].argstartel = new [STARTEL]
 24531                                  	;mov	[bx+3],si
 24532 000030E9 897703                  	mov	[bx+ARGV_ELE.argstartel],si
 24533 000030EC 8B36[9C93]              	mov	si,[COMPTR]
 24534                                  	;mov	[BX].arg_ocomptr,si ; arg_ocomptr = ptr into original com line
 24535                                  	;mov	[bx+9],si
 24536 000030F0 897709                  	mov	[bx+ARGV_ELE.arg_ocomptr],si
 24537 000030F3 89FE                    	mov	si,di			; now save argstring in argbuffer
 24538 000030F5 8B3E[1893]              	mov	di,[ARGBUF_PTR]		; load the argbuf pointer and make
 24539                                  
 24540                                  ; 27/07/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 24541                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 COMMAND.COM
 24542                                  %if 0
 24543                                  	add	di,cx			; sure we're not about to run off
 24544                                  	;cmp	DI,OFFSET TRANGROUP:arg.argbuf+ARGBLEN-1
 24545                                  	;;cmp	di,ARG_ARGBUF+255
 24546                                  	;cmp	di,ARG+ARG_UNIT.argbuf+127
 24547                                  	cmp	di,ARG+ARG_UNIT.argbuf+ARGBLEN-1
 24548                                  	jge	short buf_oflow		; the end of the buffer (plus null byte)
 24549                                  	sub	di,cx
 24550                                  %else
 24551                                  	; 27/07/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 COMMAND.COM
 24552                                  	;mov	bx,ARG_ARGBUF+127

 24554 000030FC 29FB                    	sub	bx,di	; sure we're not about to run off
 24555 000030FE 39CB                    	cmp	bx,cx

 24558                                  %endif

 24566                                  newarg_done:

 24577                                  buf_oflow:

 24579                                  %else

 24598 00003118 5F                      	pop	di
 24599 00003119 5A                      	pop	dx
 24600 0000311A 59                      	pop	cx
 24601 0000311B 5B                      	pop	bx
 24602 0000311C C3                      	retn

 24604                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 24605                                  
 24606                                  ; ARG_SWITCH decides if an argument might really be a switch. In the
 24607                                  ; event that it is, and we can recognize
 24608                                  ;
 24609                                  ; ENTRY:
 24610                                  ;   As in <newarg>.
 24611                                  ; EXIT:
 24612                                  ;   CF	    --	    clear (wasn't a switch); set (was a switch)
 24613                                  ; NOTE(S):
 24614                                  ;   *	The mechanism mapping a switch into a bit-value depends entirely
 24615                                  ;	on the order of definition in the <switch_list> variable and the
 24616                                  ;	values chosen to define the bits in CMDT:COMEQU.ASM. Change either
 24617                                  ;	<switch_list> or the definitions in CMDT:COMEQU.ASM -- and rewrite
 24618                                  ;	this mechanism. This code taken from CMDT:TCODE.ASM.
 24619                                  ;   *	The <switch_list> declared below is redundant to one declared in
 24620                                  ;	TDATA.ASM, and used in TCODE.ASM.
 24621                                  ;   *	An ugly routine.
 24622                                  
 24623                                  	; 01/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 COMMAND.COM
 24624                                  arg_switch:
 24625 0000311D 50                      	push	ax
 24626 0000311E 53                      	push	bx
 24627 0000311F 51                      	push	cx
 24628 00003120 57                      	push	di
 24629 00003121 9C                      	pushf
 24630 00003122 F6C701                  	test	bh,1 ; sw_flag		; is it a switch? (preserve flag word)
 24631 00003125 741C                    	jz	short arg_no_switch0
 24632 00003127 833E[9A93]FF            	cmp	word [LASTARG],-1 	; have we encountered any REAL args yet?
 24633 0000312C 741B                    	je	short arg_no_switch1 	; no, so leading switches don't matter
 24634 0000312E 8B1E[9A93]              	mov	bx,[LASTARG]		; yes, add switch info to last REAL arg
 24635                                  	;mov	ax,offset TRANGROUP:arg.argv
 24636                                  	;mov	ax,ARG_ARGV
 24637 00003132 B8[D48D]                	mov	ax,ARG+ARG_UNIT.argv  ; ARG+0
 24638 00003135 E81800                  	call	argv_calc
 24639                                  	;or	[BX].argsw_word,BP
 24640                                  	;or	[bx+7],bp
 24641 00003138 096F07                  	or	[bx+ARGV_ELE.argsw_word],bp
 24642                                  	;or	arg.argswinfo,BP
 24643                                  	;or	[ARG_ARGSWINFO],bp
 24644 0000313B 092E[9690]              	or	[ARG+ARG_UNIT.argswinfo],bp
 24645                                  arg_yes_switch:
 24646 0000313F 9D                      	popf
 24647 00003140 F9                      	stc
 24648 00003141 EB08                    	jmp	short arg_switch_exit
 24649                                  
 24650                                  arg_no_switch0:
 24651                                  	;mov	ax,[ARG_ARGVCNT]
 24652 00003143 A1[9490]                	mov	ax,[ARG+ARG_UNIT.argvcnt]
 24653 00003146 A3[9A93]                	mov	[LASTARG],ax
 24654                                  arg_no_switch1:
 24655 00003149 9D                      	popf
 24656 0000314A F8                      	clc
 24657                                  arg_switch_exit:
 24658 0000314B 5F                      	pop	di
 24659 0000314C 59                      	pop	cx
 24660 0000314D 5B                      	pop	bx
 24661 0000314E 58                      	pop	ax
 24662 0000314F C3                      	retn
 24663                                  
 24664                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 24665                                  
 24666                                  ; ARGV_CALC maps an array index into a byte-offset from the base of
 24667                                  ; the supplied array.  Method used for computing the address is:
 24668                                  ;	Array Index * Array Elt Size + Base Addr = Elt Addr
 24669                                  ; ENTRY:
 24670                                  ;   AX	    --	    base of array
 24671                                  ;   BX	    --	    array index
 24672                                  ; EXIT:
 24673                                  ;   BX	    --	    byte offset
 24674                                  
 24675                                  	; 01/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 COMMAND.COM
 24676                                  argv_calc:
 24677 00003150 50                      	push	ax		; Save base
 24678 00003151 88D8                    	mov	al,bl		; al = array index
 24679                                  	;mov	bl,11
 24680 00003153 B30B                    	mov	bl,ARGV_ELE.SIZE ; bl = size of an argv element
 24681 00003155 F6E3                    	mul	bl		; ax = base offset
 24682 00003157 5B                      	pop	bx		; Get base
 24683 00003158 01D8                    	add	ax,bx		; Add in base offset
 24684 0000315A 93                      	xchg	ax,bx		; Restore ax and put byte offset in bx
 24685 0000315B C3                      	retn
 24686

 24688

 24690                                  	;times 10 db 0

 24693                                  
 24694                                  ;============================================================================
 24695                                  ; PATH1.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 24696                                  ;============================================================================
 24697                                  ; 03/10/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 24698                                  
 24699                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24700                                  ;    PATH.ASM contains the routines to perform pathname incovation. Path and
 24701                                  ;    Parse share a temporary buffer and argv[] definitions. <Path_Search>,
 24702                                  ;    given a pathname, attempts to find a corresponding executable or batch
 24703                                  ;    file on disk. Directories specified in the user's search path will be
 24704                                  ;    searched for a matching file, if a match is not found in the current
 24705                                  ;    directory and if the pathname is actually only an MSDOS filename.
 24706                                  ;    <Path_Search> assumes that the parsed command name can be found in
 24707                                  ;    argv[0] -- in other words, <Parseline> should be executed prior to
 24708                                  ;    <Path_Search>. Alternatively, the command name and appropriate
 24709                                  ;    information could be placed in argv[0], or <Path_Search> could be
 24710                                  ;    (easily) modified to make no assumptions about where its input is found.
 24711                                  ;    Please find enclosed yet another important routine, <Save_Args>, which
 24712                                  ;    places the entire arg/argv[]/argbuf structure on a piece of newly
 24713                                  ;    allocated memory. This is handy for for-loop processing, and anything
 24714                                  ;    else that wants to save the whole shebang and then process other command
 24715                                  ;    lines.
 24716                                  ;
 24717                                  ; Alan L, OS/MSDOS				    August 15, 1983
 24718                                  ;
 24719                                  ; ENTRY:
 24720                                  ;   <Path_Search>:	    argv[0].
 24721                                  ;   <Save_Args>:	    bytes to allocate in addition to arg structure
 24722                                  ; EXIT:
 24723                                  ;   <Path_Search>:	    success flag, best pathname match in EXECPATH.
 24724                                  ;   <Save_Args>:	    success flag, segment address of new memory
 24725                                  ; NOTE(S):
 24726                                  ;   *	<Argv_calc> handily turns an array index into an absolute pointer.
 24727                                  ;	The computation depends on the size of an argv[] element (arg_ele).
 24728                                  ;   *	<Parseline> calls <cparse> for chunks of the command line. <Cparse>
 24729                                  ;	does not function as specified; see <Parseline> for more details.
 24730                                  ;   *	<Parseline> now knows about the flags the internals of COMMAND.COM
 24731                                  ;	need to know about. This extra information is stored in a switch_flag
 24732                                  ;	word with each command-line argument; the switches themselves will not
 24733                                  ;	appear in the resulting arg structure.
 24734                                  ;   *	With the exception of CARRY, flags are generally preserved across calls.
 24735                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24736                                  
 24737                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 24738                                  
 24739                                  ; PATH_SEARCH tries to find the file it's given, somewhere. An initial value
 24740                                  ; of *argv[0].argstartel == 0 implies that there is no command (empty line
 24741                                  ; or 'd:' or 'd:/'). This check is done in strip; otherwise, strip formats
 24742                                  ; the filename/pathname into tpbuf. Search(tpbuf) is executed to see if we
 24743                                  ; have a match, either in the current working directory if we were handed
 24744                                  ; a filename, or in the specified directory, given a pathname. If this call
 24745                                  ; fails, and we were given a pathname, then Path_Search fails. Otherwise,
 24746                                  ; Path_Crunch is repeatedly invoked on tpbuf[STARTEL] (if there's a drive
 24747                                  ; prefix, we want to skip it) for each pathstring in userpath. Success on
 24748                                  ; either the first invocation of search or on one of the succeeding calls
 24749                                  ; sets up the appropriate information for copying the successful pathname
 24750                                  ; prefix (if any) into the result buffer, followed by the successful filename
 24751                                  ; match (from [search_best_buf]). The result is returned in in EXECPATH.
 24752                                  ;
 24753                                  ; ENTRY:
 24754                                  ;   argv[0]		--	command name and associated information
 24755                                  ; EXIT:
 24756                                  ;   AX			--	non-zero indicates type of file found
 24757                                  ;   EXECPATH		--	successful pathname (AX non-zero)
 24758                                  ; NOTE(S):
 24759                                  ;   1)	Uses the temporary buffer, tpbuf, from the parse routines.
 24760                                  ;   2)	Some files are more equal than others.	See search: for rankings.
 24761                                  ;   3)	Path_Search terminates as soon as a call to search succeeds, even
 24762                                  ;	if search returns an .exe or .bat.
 24763                                  ;   5)	Clobbers dma address.
 24764                                  
 24765                                  PBUFLEN 	EQU	128		; length of EXECPATH
 24766                                  PATH_SEP_CHAR	EQU	';'
 24767                                  
 24768                                  ;parseflags RECORD special_delim:1, unused:4, path_sep:1, wildcard:1, sw_flag:1
 24769                                  
 24770                                  	;special_delim equ 128
 24771                                  	;path_sep equ 4
 24772                                  	;wildcard equ 2
 24773                                  	;sw_flag  equ 1
 24774                                  
 24775                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24776                                  
 24777                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 2510h
 24778                                  
 24779                                  ; 18/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 24780                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 32D1h
 24781                                  
 24782                                  path_search:
 24783 00003160 53                      	push	bx
 24784 00003161 51                      	push	cx
 24785 00003162 52                      	push	dx		; could use a "stack 'em" instruction
 24786 00003163 56                      	push	si
 24787 00003164 57                      	push	di
 24788 00003165 55                      	push	bp
 24789 00003166 9C                      	pushf
 24790                                  
 24791                                  	;test	ds:arg.argv[0].argflags, (MASK wildcard) + (MASK sw_flag)
 24792                                  	;test	byte [ARGV0_ARG_FLAGS],3
 24793 00003167 F606[D68D]03            	test	byte [ARG+ARGV_ELE.argflags],3 ; wildcard+sw_flag
 24794 0000316C 7403                    	jz	short path_search_ok
 24795                                  path_failure_jmp:
 24796 0000316E E9C100                  	jmp	path_failure	; ambiguous commands not allowed
 24797                                  
 24798                                  path_search_ok:
 24799 00003171 E85201                  	call	STORE_PCHAR	; figure out the pathname separator
 24800 00003174 BA[9E93]                	mov	dx,FBUF		; clobber old dma value with
 24801 00003177 B8001A                  	mov	ax,Set_DMA*256 ; 1A00h ; a pointer to our dma buffer
 24802 0000317A CD21                    	int	21h	; DOS -	SET DISK TRANSFER AREA ADDRESS
 24803                                  			; DS:DX	-> disk	transfer buffer
 24804 0000317C 06                      	push	es
 24805 0000317D E88DF1                  	call	find_path	; get a handle (ES:DI) on user path
 24806 00003180 8C06[C993]              	mov	[pathinfo+0],es	; and squirrel it away
 24807 00003184 893E[CB93]              	mov	[pathinfo+2],di	; "old" pathstring pointer
 24808 00003188 893E[CD93]              	mov	[pathinfo+4],di	; "new" pathstring pointer
 24809 0000318C 07                      	pop	es
 24810                                  	
 24811 0000318D BB8000                  	mov	bx,PBUFLEN ; 128 ; copy/format argv[0] into temp buffer
 24812 00003190 BE[ED89]                	mov	si,EXECPATH
 24813 00003193 E88002                  	call	STRIP
 24814 00003196 72D6                    	jc	short path_failure_jmp ; if possible, of course
 24815                                  		
 24816 00003198 89F2                    	mov	dx,si		; search (EXECPATH, error_message)
 24817 0000319A C706[1E94][777F]        	mov	word [search_error],baddrv_ptr
 24818 000031A0 E89F01                  	call	PSEARCH		; must do at least one search
 24819 000031A3 09C0                    	or	ax,ax		; find anything?
 24820 000031A5 7469                    	jz	short path_noinit
 24821                                  				; failure ... search farther	
 24822 000031A7 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax		; success... save filetype code	
 24823 000031A9 BF[ED89]                	mov	di,EXECPATH
 24824                                  	;mov	si,ds:arg.argv[0].argpointer
 24825                                  	;mov	si,[ARG_ARGV]
 24826 000031AC 8B36[D48D]              	mov	si,[ARG+ARGV_ELE.argpointer]
 24827                                  	;mov	cx,ds:arg.argv[0].argstartel
 24828                                  	;mov	cx,[ARGV0_ARGSTARTEL]
 24829 000031B0 8B0E[D78D]              	mov	cx,[ARG+ARGV_ELE.argstartel]
 24830 000031B4 29F1                    	sub	cx,si		; compute prefix bytes to copy
 24831                                  
 24832                                  ; We have the number of bytes in the prefix (up to the final component).
 24833                                  ; We need to form the complete pathname including leading drive and current
 24834                                  ; directory.
 24835                                  ;
 24836                                  ; Is there a drive letter present?
 24837                                  
 24838 000031B6 B43A                    	mov	ah,':'
 24839 000031B8 83F902                  	cmp	cx,2		; room for drive letter?
 24840 000031BB 7205                    	jb	short adddrive	; no, stick it in
 24841 000031BD 386401                  	cmp	[si+1],	ah	; colon present?
 24842 000031C0 7408                    	je	short movedrive	; yes, just move it
 24843                                  adddrive:
 24844 000031C2 A0[D98A]                	mov	al,[CURDRV]	; get current drive
 24845 000031C5 0441                    	add	al,'A'		; convert to uppercase letter
 24846 000031C7 AB                      	stosw			; store d:
 24847 000031C8 EB05                    	jmp	short checkpath
 24848                                  
 24849                                  movedrive:
 24850 000031CA AD                      	lodsw			; move d:
 24851 000031CB AB                      	stosw
 24852 000031CC 83E902                  	sub	cx,2		; 2 bytes less to move
 24853                                  checkpath:
 24854 000031CF 0C20                    	or	al,20h
 24855 000031D1 88C2                    	mov	dl,al		
 24856                                  	;sub	dl,60h

 24865                                  ; Otherwise, get current dir for DL.

 24893                                  	;cmp	byte [di],0	; end of string?
 24894                                  	;jz	short foundend

 24896                                  	;jmp	short scanend

 24999                                  			; DL = drive (0=default,1=A,etc.)
 25000                                  			; DS:SI	points to 64-byte buffer area

 25008                                  path_cpy:

 25014 0000328B 1F                      	pop	ds
 25015 0000328C FC                      	cld

 25065                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 25066                                  
 25067                                  ; STORE_PCHAR determines the pathname-element separator and squirrels
 25068                                  ; it away. In other words, must we say '/bin/ls' or '\bin\ls'?
 25069                                  ;
 25070                                  ; ENTRY:
 25071                                  ; EXIT:
 25072                                  ; NOTE(S):
 25073                                  ;   *	Uses <psep_char>, defined in <path_search>.
 25074                                  
 25075                                  	; 18/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 25076                                  STORE_PCHAR:
 25077 000032C6 50                      	push	ax
 25078 000032C7 B02F                    	mov	al,'/'		; is the pathname-element separator
 25079 000032C9 E8A0F3                  	call	pathchrcmp	; a regular slash?
 25080 000032CC 7402                    	jz	short STORE_SLASH
 25081                                  				; if yes, remember slash
 25082 000032CE B05C                    	mov	al,'\'
 25083                                  	; 18/03/2023
 25084                                  	;mov	[psep_char],al	; otherwise, remember back-slash
 25085                                  	;pop	ax
 25086                                  	;retn
 25087                                  STORE_SLASH:
 25088 000032D0 A2[CF93]                	mov	[psep_char],al
 25089 000032D3 58                      	pop	ax
 25090 000032D4 C3                      	retn
