 25092                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 25093                                  
 25094                                  ; PATH_CRUNCH takes a prefix from a prefix string, and a suffix from
 25095                                  ; EXECPATH, and smooshes them into tpbuf. The caller may supply an
 25096                                  ; additional separator to use for breaking up the path-string. Null is the
 25097                                  ; default. Once the user-string has been formed, search is invoked to see
 25098                                  ; what's out there.
 25099                                  ;
 25100                                  ; ENTRY:
 25101                                  ;   BH			--	additional terminator character
 25102                                  ;   SI			--	pointer into pathstring to be dissected
 25103                                  ;   DX			--	pointer to stripped filename
 25104                                  ; EXIT:
 25105                                  ;   AX			--	non-zero (file type), zero (nothing found)
 25106                                  ;   SI			--	moves along pathstring from call to call
 25107                                  ;   [search_best_buf]	--	name of best file (AX non-zero)
 25108                                  ;   [tpbuf]		--	clobbered
 25109                                  ; NOTE(S):
 25110                                  ;   *	Implicit in this code is the ability to specify when to search
 25111                                  ;	the current directory (if at all) through the PATH defined by
 25112                                  ;	the user, a la UNIX (e.g., PATH=;c:\bin;c:\etc searches the
 25113                                  ;	current directory before the bin and etc directories of drive c).
 25114                                  
 25115                                  	; 18/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 25116                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:3454h
 25117                                  	
 25118                                  path_crunch:
 25119 000032D5 53                      	push	bx
 25120 000032D6 51                      	push	cx
 25121 000032D7 52                      	push	dx
 25122 000032D8 57                      	push	di
 25123 000032D9 56                      	push	si
 25124                                  	;pushf	; ** ; 18/03/2023
 25125 000032DA E8E9FF                  	call	STORE_PCHAR	; figure out pathname separator
 25126 000032DD BF[1A93]                	mov	di,TPBUF	; destination of concatenated string
 25127 000032E0 8B36[CD93]              	mov	si,[pathinfo+4]	; "new" pointer to start with
 25128 000032E4 8936[CB93]              	mov	[pathinfo+2],si	; becomes "old" pointer
 25129 000032E8 1E                      	push	ds		; save old segment pointer
 25130 000032E9 FF36[C993]              	push	word [pathinfo+0]
 25131                                  				; replace with pointer to userpath's
 25132 000032ED 1F                      	pop	ds		; segment
 25133                                  	; 26/04/2023
 25134 000032EE 30C9                    	xor	cl,cl		;AN000; clear flag for later use 3/3/KK	
 25135                                  path_cr_copy:
 25136 000032F0 AC                      	lodsb			; get a pathname byte
 25137 000032F1 08C0                    	or	al,al		; check for terminator(s)
 25138 000032F3 7414                    	jz	short path_seg	; null terminates segment & pathstring
 25139 000032F5 38F8                    	cmp	al,bh
 25140 000032F7 7410                    	je	short path_seg	; BH terminates a pathstring segment
 25141                                  	;
 25142                                  	; 18/03/2023
 25143                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& 5.0) COMMAND.COM
 25144 000032F9 E8C3F0                  	call	testkanj	;AN000; 3/3/KK
 25145 000032FC 7406                    	jz	short _notkanj2	;AN000; 3/3/KK
 25146 000032FE AA                      	stosb			;AN000; 3/3/KK
 25147 000032FF A4                      	movsb			;AN000; 3/3/KK
 25148 00003300 B101                    	mov	cl,1 ; *	;AN000; CL=1 means latest stored char is DBCS 3/3/KK	
 25149 00003302 EBEC                    	jmp	short path_cr_copy
 25150                                  _notkanj2:
 25151 00003304 30C9                    	xor	cl,cl ; *	;AN000; CL=0 means latest stored char is SBCS 3/3/KK
 25152                                  	;
 25153 00003306 AA                      	stosb
 25154 00003307 EBE7                    	jmp	short path_cr_copy
 25155                                  
 25156                                  path_seg:
 25157 00003309 1F                      	pop	ds		; restore old data segment
 25158 0000330A 8936[CD93]              	mov	[pathinfo+4],si	; save "new" pointer for next time
 25159 0000330E 88C3                    	mov	bl,al		; remember if we saw null or not...
 25160                                  				;;; REMOVE NEXT 3 LINES FOR CURDIR SPEC
 25161 00003310 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax		; in case nothing in pathstr...
 25162 00003312 81FF[1A93]              	cmp	di,TPBUF	; was there really anything in pathstr?		
 25163 00003316 7421                    	je	short path_cr_leave
 25164                                  				; if nothing was copied, pathstr empty
 25165                                  path_cr_look:
 25166 00003318 A0[CF93]                	mov	al,[psep_char]	; form complete pathname
 25167                                  	;
 25168                                  	; 18/03/2023
 25169                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 25170 0000331B 08C9                    	or	cl,cl ; *	;AN000; 3/3/KK
 25171 0000331D 7505                    	jnz	short path_cr_store
 25172                                  				;AN000; this is a trailing byte of ECS code 3/3/KK
 25173                                  	;
 25174 0000331F 3A45FF                  	cmp	al,[di-1]	; add pathname separator for suffix
 25175 00003322 7401                    	je	short path_cr_l1
 25176                                  path_cr_store:
 25177 00003324 AA                      	stosb
 25178                                  path_cr_l1:
 25179 00003325 89D6                    	mov	si,dx
 25180                                  path_cr_l2:
 25181 00003327 AC                      	lodsb			; tack the stripped filename onto
 25182 00003328 AA                      	stosb			; the end of the path, up to and
 25183 00003329 08C0                    	or	al,al		; including the terminating null
 25184 0000332B 75FA                    	jnz	short path_cr_l2
 25185 0000332D BA[1A93]                	mov	dx,TPBUF	; and look for an appropriate file...	
 25186 00003330 C706[1E94][7380]        	mov	word [search_error],BADPMES_PTR
 25187                                  	;invoke search
 25188 00003336 E80900                  	call	PSEARCH		; results are in AX & search_best_buf
 25189                                  
 25190                                  	; 18/03/2023
 25191                                  ;path_cr_leave:
 25192                                  	;or	bl,bl		; did we finish off the pathstring?
 25193                                  	;jz	short path_cr_empty
 25194                                  	;			; null in BL means all gone...
 25195                                  	;popf	; **		; otherwise, plenty left
 25196                                  	;clc
 25197                                  	;jmp	short path_cr_exit
 25198                                  ;path_cr_empty:
 25199                                  	;popf	; **
 25200                                  	;stc
 25201                                  ;path_cr_exit:
 25202                                  
 25203                                  	; 18/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 25204                                  path_cr_leave:
 25205                                  	;popf ; ** ; 18/03/2023
 25206 00003339 80FB01                  	cmp	bl,1	; if bl = 0 -> cf = 1 (path_cr_empty:)
 25207                                  	
 25208                                  path_cr_exit:
 25209 0000333C 5E                      	pop	si
 25210 0000333D 5F                      	pop	di
 25211 0000333E 5A                      	pop	dx
 25212 0000333F 59                      	pop	cx
 25213 00003340 5B                      	pop	bx
 25214 00003341 C3                      	retn

 25216                                  ;============================================================================
 25217                                  ; PATH2.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 25218                                  ;============================================================================
 25219                                  ; 02/10/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 25220                                  
 25221                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25222                                  ;   SEARCH, when given a pathname, attempts to find a file with
 25223                                  ; one of the following extensions: .com, .exe, .bat (highest to
 25224                                  ; lowest priority). Where conflicts arise, the extension with
 25225                                  ; the highest priority is favored.
 25226                                  ; ENTRY:
 25227                                  ;   DX		--	pointer to null-terminated pathname
 25228                                  ;   fbuf	--	dma buffer for findfirst/next
 25229                                  ; EXIT:
 25230                                  ;   AX		--	8)  file found with .com extension
 25231                                  ;			4)  file found with .exe extension
 25232                                  ;			2)  file found with .bat extension
 25233                                  ;			0)  no such file to be found
 25234                                  ;   (if AX is non-zero:)
 25235                                  ;   [search_best]	identical to AX
 25236                                  ;   [search_best_buf]	null-terminated filename
 25237                                  ; NOTES:
 25238                                  ;   1) Requires caller to have allocated a dma buffer and executed a setdma.
 25239                                  ;---------------
 25240                                  ; CONSTANTS:
 25241                                  ;---------------
 25242                                  SEARCH_FILE_NOT_FOUND	EQU	0
 25243                                  SEARCH_COM		EQU	8
 25244                                  SEARCH_EXE		EQU	4
 25245                                  SEARCH_BAT		EQU	2
 25246                                  FNAME_LEN		EQU	8
 25247                                  FNAME_MAX_LEN		EQU	13
 25248                                  DOT			EQU	'.'
 25249                                  WILDCHAR		EQU	'?'
 25250                                  
 25251                                  
 25252                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 25253                                  
 25254                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 26D6h
 25255                                  
 25256                                  	; 18/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 25257                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:34C9h
 25258                                  	
 25259                                  PSEARCH:
 25260 00003342 51                      	push	cx
 25261 00003343 52                      	push	dx
 25262 00003344 57                      	push	di
 25263 00003345 56                      	push	si
 25264                                  	;pushf	; ** ; 18/03/2023
 25265 00003346 52                      	push	dx		; check drivespec (save pname ptr)
 25266 00003347 89D7                    	mov	di,dx		; working copy of pathname
 25267 00003349 BE[DE93]                	mov	si,search_curdir_buf
 25268 0000334C 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; zero means current drive
 25269 0000334E 807D013A                	cmp	byte [di+1],':'	; is there a drive spec?
 25270 00003352 7508                    	jne	short SEARCH_DIR_CHECK
 25271 00003354 8A15                    	mov	dl,[di]		; get the drive byte
 25272 00003356 80E2DF                  	and	dl,0DFh ; ~20h	; uppercase the sucker
 25273 00003359 80EA40                  	sub	dl,'@' ; 40h	; and convert to drive number
 25274                                  SEARCH_DIR_CHECK:
 25275 0000335C B80047                  	mov	ax,Current_Dir*256 ; 4700h
 25276 0000335F CD21                    	int	21h	; DOS -	2+ - GET CURRENT DIRECTORY
 25277                                  			; DL = drive (0=default,1=A,etc.)
 25278                                  			; DS:SI	points to 64-byte buffer area
 25279 00003361 5A                      	pop	dx		; directory? If we can't we'll		
 25280 00003362 724C                    	jc	short SEARCH_INVALID_DRIVE
 25281                                  				; assume it's a bad drive...
 25282 00003364 B91300                  	mov	cx,search_attr	; 13h
 25283                                  				; filetypes to search for
 25284 00003367 B8004E                  	mov	ax,Find_First*256 ; 4E00h ; request first match, if any
 25285 0000336A CD21                    	int	21h	; DOS -	2+ - FIND FIRST	ASCIZ (FINDFIRST)
 25286                                  			; CX = search attributes
 25287                                  			; DS:DX	-> ASCIZ filespec
 25288                                  			; (drive,path, and wildcards allowed)
 25289 0000336C 7249                    	jc	short SEARCH_NO_FILE
 25290 0000336E C606[D093]00            	mov	byte [search_best],SEARCH_FILE_NOT_FOUND ; 0
 25291 00003373 C606[D193]00            	mov	byte [search_best_buf],ANULL
 25292                                  				; 0 ; nothing's been found, yet

 25441                                  ; STRIP copies the source string (argv[0]) into the destination buffer,
 25442                                  ; replacing any extension with wildcards.
 25443                                  ;
 25444                                  ; ENTRY:
 25445                                  ;	BX	--	maximum length of destination buffer
 25446                                  ;	DS:SI	--	address of destination buffer
 25447                                  ;	argv[0] --	command name to be stripped
 25448                                  ; EXIT:
 25449                                  ;	CF	--	set if failure, clear if successful
 25450                                  ; NOTE(S):
 25451                                  
 25452                                  	; 18/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 25453                                  
 25454                                  STRIP:
 25455 00003416 50                      	push	ax
 25456 00003417 53                      	push	bx
 25457 00003418 51                      	push	cx
 25458 00003419 52                      	push	dx
 25459 0000341A 57                      	push	di
 25460 0000341B 56                      	push	si
 25461                                  	;pushf	; ** ; 18/03/2023
 25462                                  		
 25463                                  	; 05/05/2023
 25464                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 25465 0000341C C606[8A8D]01            	mov	byte [ext_entered],1

 25467                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)

 25473                                  	;mov	di,ds:arg.argv[0].argstartel
 25474                                  				; beginning of last pathname element
 25475                                  	;mov	di,[ARGV0_ARGSTARTEL] ; beginning of last pathname element

 25478 0000342C 743D                    	je	short STRIP_ERROR
 25479 0000342E 89D1                    	mov	cx,dx		; compute where end of argstring lies
 25480                                  	;add	cx,ds:arg.argv[0].arglen

 25498                                  	;mov	al,0

 25500                                  PROCESS_EXT:
 25501                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 25502 00003445 89F9                    	mov	cx,di		; pointer to end of argstring yields
 25503 00003447 29D1                    	sub	cx,dx		; number of bytes to be copied

 25505 0000344C 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx

 25507                                  				; if not, we must have a bad pathname

 25509 00003452 89D6                    	mov	si,dx		; source is beginning of pathname
 25510 00003454 FC                      	cld
 25511 00003455 F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; SI=arg,DI=buffer,CX=argend-argbeg
 25512

 25514                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 25548                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 25549                                  
 25550                                  ; SAVE_ARGS attempts to preserve the existing argv[]/argvcnt/argbuffer
 25551                                  ;
 25552                                  ; structure in newly allocated memory. The argv[] structure is found at the
 25553                                  ; beginning of this area. The caller indicates how much extra space is
 25554                                  ; needed in the resulting structure; Save_Args returns a segment number and
 25555                                  ; an offset into that area, indicating where the caller may preserve its own
 25556                                  ; data. Note that <argvcnt> can be found at <offset-2>.
 25557                                  ; ENTRY:
 25558                                  ;   BX	    --	size (in bytes) of extra area to allocate
 25559                                  ; EXIT:
 25560                                  ;   AX	    --	segment of new area.
 25561                                  ;   CF	    --	set if unable to save a copy.
 25562                                  ; NOTE(S):
 25563                                  ;   1)	The allocated area will be AT LEAST the size requested -- since
 25564                                  ;	the underlying MSDOS call, <alloc> returns an integral number of
 25565                                  ;	paragraphs.
 25566                                  ;   2)	It is an error if MSDOS can't allocate AT LEAST as much memory
 25567                                  ;	as the caller of Save_Args requests.
 25568                                  ;   3)	AX is undefined if CF indicates an error.
 25569                                  
 25570                                  	; 19/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 25571                                  
 25572                                  SAVE_ARGS:
 25573 00003473 53                      	push	bx
 25574 00003474 51                      	push	cx
 25575 00003475 52                      	push	dx
 25576 00003476 57                      	push	di
 25577 00003477 56                      	push	si
 25578 00003478 55                      	push	bp
 25579                                  	; 01/05/2023
 25580                                  	; 26/04/2023
 25581                                  	;pushf ; **
 25582                                  	;add	bx,1363		; space for arg structure, round up
 25583 00003479 81C35304                	add	bx,ARG_UNIT.SIZE+15 ; 1348+15
 25584                                  			; 1092+15 ; 31/07/2024
 25585 0000347D B104                    	mov	cl,4		; to paragraph size and convert
 25586 0000347F D3EB                    	shr	bx,cl		; size in bytes to size in paragraphs
 25587 00003481 B80048                  	mov	ax,ALLOC*256 ; 4800h
 25588 00003484 CD21                    	int	21h	; DOS -	2+ - ALLOCATE MEMORY
 25589                                  			; BX = number of 16-byte paragraphs desired
 25590 00003486 7242                    	jc	short SAVE_ERROR ; ***
 25591 00003488 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax		; save segment id
 25592 0000348A 06                      	push	es		; save TRANGROUP address
 25593 0000348B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; switch to new memory segment
 25594                                  	; assume es:nothing
 25595                                  	;mov	cx,1348		; get back structure size
 25596 0000348D B94404                  	mov	cx,ARG_UNIT.SIZE ; 1092 ; 31/07/2024
 25597 00003490 31FF                    	xor	di,di		; destination is new memory area
 25598                                  	;mov	si,ARG_ARGV
 25599 00003492 BE[D48D]                	mov	si,ARG		; source is arg structure
 25600 00003495 F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move that sucker!
 25601                                  	;mov	cx,arg.argvcnt 	; adjust argv pointers
 25602                                  	;mov	cx,[ARG_ARGVCNT]
 25603 00003497 8B0E[9490]              	mov	cx,[ARG+ARG_UNIT.argvcnt]
 25604 0000349B 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax		; base address for argv_calc
 25605                                  
 25606                                  ;	Bugbug:	What did they mean by this?
 25607                                  ;	Note that the replacement line produces exactly the same code.
 25608                                  ;;	mov	SI, OFFSET TRANGROUP:arg.argbuf - OFFSET arg_unit.argbuf
 25609                                  ;	mov	SI, OFFSET TRANGROUP:arg
 25610                                  
 25611                                  	;mov	si,ARG_ARGV
 25612 0000349D BE[D48D]                	mov	si,ARG	
 25613                                  SAVE_PTR_LOOP:
 25614 000034A0 49                      	dec	cx		; exhausted all args?
 25615 000034A1 7C24                    	jl	short SAVE_DONE
 25616 000034A3 89CB                    	mov	bx,cx		; get arg index and
 25617 000034A5 E8A8FC                  	call	argv_calc	; convert to a pointer
 25618                                  	;mov	dx,ds:arg.argv[bx].argpointer
 25619                                  	;mov	dx,[ARG_ARGV+bx]
 25620 000034A8 8B97[D48D]              	mov	dx,[ARG+ARGV_ELE.argpointer+bx]
 25621 000034AC 29F2                    	sub	dx,si		; adjust argpointer
 25622                                  	;mov	es:argv[BX].argpointer,dx
 25623                                  	;mov	[es:bx+ARGV_ELE.argpointer],dx ; mov [es:bx+0],dx
 25624 000034AE 268917                  	mov	[es:bx],dx

 25626                                  	;mov	dx,[ARGV0_ARGSTARTEL+bx]

 25630                                  	;mov	[es:bx+3],dx

 25632                                  	;mov	dx,ds:arg.argv[bx].arg_ocomptr
 25633                                  	;mov	dx,[ARGV0_OCOMPTR+bx]
 25634 000034BB 8B97[DD8D]              	mov	dx,[ARG+ARGV_ELE.arg_ocomptr+bx]
 25635 000034BF 29F2                    	sub	dx,si		; and adjust arg_ocomptr

 25638 000034C1 26895709                	mov	[es:bx+ARGV_ELE.arg_ocomptr],dx

 25649                                  ;SAVE_ERROR:

 25659                                  	; cf = 0 ; *
 25660                                  	;clc
 25661                                  SAVE_EXIT:
 25662                                  SAVE_ERROR:	; 26/04/2023 (cf=1) ; ***
 25663 000034CA 5D                      	pop	bp
 25664 000034CB 5E                      	pop	si
 25665 000034CC 5F                      	pop	di
 25666 000034CD 5A                      	pop	dx
 25667 000034CE 59                      	pop	cx

 25683                                  ; ****************************************************************
 25684                                  ; *
 25685                                  ; * ROUTINE:	 NOTEST2 - execution of DEL/ERASE command
 25686                                  ; *
 25687                                  ; * FUNCTION:	 Delete files based on user parsed input. Prompt
 25688                                  ; *		 user for Y/N if necessary. If an error occurs,
 25689                                  ; *		 set up an error message and go to CERROR.

 25692                                  ; *		 Current directory set to entered directory

 25696                                  ; ****************************************************************
 25697                                  ;
 25698                                  ; ARE YOU SURE prompt when deleting *.*
 25699

 25702                                  notest2:

 25724                                  			; AL must be 01h,06h,07h,08h or 0Ah.
 25725 000034F6 AD                      	lodsw

 25727 000034F9 74E7                    	jz	short askagn

 26213                                  ; * ROUTINE:	 ON_OFF
 26214                                  ; *
 26215                                  ; * FUNCTION:	 Parse the command line for an optional ON or
 26216                                  ; *		 OFF string for the BREAK, VERIFY, and ECHO
 26217                                  ; *		 routines.
 26218                                  ; *
 26219                                  ; * INPUT:	 command line at offset 81H
 26220                                  ; *		 PARSE_BREAK control block
 26221                                  ; *
 26222                                  ; * OUTPUT:	 If carry is clear
 26223                                  ; *		    If ON is found
 26224                                  ; *		       Zero flag set
 26225                                  ; *		    If OFF is found
 26226                                  ; *		       Zero flag clear
 26227                                  ; *		 If carry set
 26228                                  ; *		    If nothing on command line
 26229                                  ; *		       CL set to zero
 26230                                  ; *		    If error
 26231                                  ; *		       CL contains error value from parse
 26232                                  ; *
 26233                                  ; ****************************************************************
 26234                                  
 26235                                  	; 19/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 26236                                  ON_OFF:

 26286                                  
 26287                                  parse_on_off:			;AN032;    and start parsing
 26288 00003688 BF[8F84]                	mov	di,PARSE_BREAK	;AN000; Get address of PARSE_BREAK
 26289 0000368B 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx		;AN000; clear cx,dx
 26290 0000368D 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		;AN000;
 26291 0000368F E88C0C                  	call	cmd_parse	;AC000; call parser
 26292                                  	;cmp	ax,-1 ; 0FFFFh
 26293 00003692 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,END_OF_LINE	;AC000; are we at end of line?

 26303                                  on_off_there:
 26304 0000369F 803E[7595]FF            	cmp	byte [PARSE1_CODE],-1 ; 0FFh
 26305                                  				;AN014; was a valid positional present?

 26316 000036B1 9C                      	pushf			;AN000; save flags

 26326                                  	;jmp	short on_off_end
 26327                                  				;AN000; return to caller

 26329 000036C1 C3                      	retn

 26360                                  PRINTVOL:
 26361                                  	push	ax		; AX return from SEARCH_FIRST for VOL ID
 26362                                  	mov	al,[FCB] ; 5Ch	; get drive letter
 26363                                  	add	al,'@'

 26366                                  	mov	al,[CURDRV]
 26367                                  	add	al,[CAPITAL_A]

 26373                                  	jnz	short PRINTVOL2	; print no volume message

 26382                                  	mov	cx,11
 26383                                  	rep	movsb
 26384                                  	xor	ax,ax
 26385                                  	;xor	al,al  ; MSDOS 6.0
 26386                                  	stosb			; store a zero to terminate the string
 26387                                  PRINTVOL2:
 26388                                  	mov	[VOLNAME_ADDR],dx
 26389                                  	mov	dx,VOLMESPTR
 26390                                  	jmp	PRINTF_CRLF

 26512                                  ; for output. Date will be returned in CX,DX.
 26513                                  
 26514                                  GetDate:
 26515 000036E4 BF[1A93]                	mov	di,Arg_Buf		;AC000; target for day of week
 26516 000036E7 B42A                    	mov	ah,Get_Date ;2Ah	;AC000; get current date
 26517 000036E9 CD21                    	int	21h			;AC000; Get date in CX:DX
 26518 000036EB 98                      	cbw				;AC000;
 26519 000036EC 51                      	push	cx			;AN000; save date returned in
 26520 000036ED 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;  CX:DX
 26521 000036EE 89C6                    	mov	si,ax
 26522 000036F0 D1E6                    	shl	si,1
 26523 000036F2 01C6                    	add	si,ax			; SI=AX*3
 26524 000036F4 89F1                    	mov	cx,si			;AN000; save si
 26525 000036F6 A1[D27F]                	mov	ax,[WeekTab]		;AN000; get message number of weektab
 26526 000036F9 B6FF                    	mov	dh,util_msg_class ;0FFh	;AN000; this is a utility message
 26527 000036FB 57                      	push	di			;AN000; save argument buffer
 26528 000036FC E8D517                  	call	TSYSGETMSG		;AN000; get the address of the message
 26529 000036FF 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000; retrieve argument buffer
 26530 00003700 01CE                    	add	si,cx			;AC000; get day of week
 26531 00003702 B90300                  	mov	cx,3
 26532 00003705 F3A4                      	rep	movsb
 26533 00003707 B000                    	mov	al,END_OF_LINE_OUT ; 0	;AC000; terminate the string
 26534 00003709 AA                      	stosb
 26535 0000370A 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000; get back date
 26536 0000370B 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 26537 0000370C C3                      	retn

 26570                                  ; ****************************************************************
 26571                                  ; *
 26572                                  ; * ROUTINE:	 UPCONV     (ADDED BY EMG 4.00)
 26573                                  ; *
 26574                                  ; * FUNCTION:	 This routine returns the upper case equivalent of
 26575                                  ; *		 the character in AL from the file upper case table
 26576                                  ; *		 in DOS if character if above  ascii 128, else
 26577                                  ; *		 subtracts 20H if between "a" and "z".
 26578                                  ; *
 26579                                  ; * INPUT:	 AL	      char to be upper cased
 26580                                  ; *		 FUCASE_ADDR  set to the file upper case table
 26581                                  ; *
 26582                                  ; * OUTPUT:	 AL	      upper cased character
 26583                                  ; *
 26584                                  ; ****************************************************************
 26585                                  ;
 26586                                  ;assume	ds:trangroup				;AN000;
 26587                                  ;
 26588                                  ;upconv	proc	near				;AN000;
 26589                                  ;
 26590                                  ;	cmp	al,80h				;AN000;  see if char is > ascii 128
 26591                                  ;	jb	oth_fucase			;AN000;  no - upper case math
 26592                                  ;	sub	al,80h				;AN000;  only upper 128 chars in table
 26593                                  ;	push	ds				;AN000;
 26594                                  ;	push	bx				;AN000;
 26595                                  ;	mov	ds,[resseg]			;AN000;  get resident data segment
 26596                                  ;assume	ds:resgroup				;AN000;
 26597                                  ;	lds	bx,dword ptr FUCase_Addr+1	;AN000;  get table address
 26598                                  ;	add	bx,2				;AN000;  skip over first word
 26599                                  ;	xlat	ds:byte ptr [bx]		;AN000;  convert to upper case
 26600                                  ;	pop	bx				;AN000;
 26601                                  ;	pop	ds				;AN000;
 26602                                  ;assume	ds:trangroup				;AN000;
 26603                                  ;	jmp	short upconv_end		;AN000;  we finished - exit
 26604                                  ;
 26605                                  ;oth_fucase:					;AN000;
 26606                                  ;	cmp	al,small_a			;AC000; if between "a" and "z",
 26607                                  ;	jb	upconv_end			;AC000;     subtract 20h to get
 26608                                  ;	cmp	al,small_z			;AC000;    upper case equivalent.
 26609                                  ;	ja	upconv_end			;AC000;
 26610                                  ;	sub	al,20h				;AC000; Change lower-case to upper
 26611                                  ;
 26612                                  ;upconv_end:					;AN000;
 26613                                  ;	ret
 26614                                  ;
 26615                                  ;upconv	endp					;AN000;
 26616                                  
 26617                                  
 26618                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 26619                                  
 26620                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 29F2h
 26621                                  
 26622                                  ; 21/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 26623                                  %if 0
 26624                                  
 26625                                  UPCONV:
 26626                                  	cmp	al,80h
 26627                                  	jb	short OTH_UCASE
 26628                                  	sub	al,80h
 26629                                  	push	ds
 26630                                  	push	bx
 26631                                  	mov	ds,[RESSEG]
 26632                                  	lds	bx,[UPPERCASETBL]
 26633                                  	add	bx,2
 26634                                  	xlat
 26635                                  	pop	bx
 26636                                  	pop	ds
 26637                                  	jmp	short UPCONV_RETN
 26638                                  
 26639                                  OTH_UCASE:
 26640                                  	cmp	al,'a'
 26641                                  	jb	short UPCONV_RETN
 26642                                  	cmp	al,'z'
 26643                                  	ja	short UPCONV_RETN
 26644                                  	sub	al,20h
 26645                                  
 26646                                  UPCONV_RETN:
 26647                                  	retn
 26648                                  
 26649                                  %endif

 26668                                  
 26669                                  ;***	MODIFICATION HISTORY
 26670                                  
 26671                                  ;11/01/83 EE  Added a few lines at the end of SCANSRC2 to get multiple
 26672                                  ;	     file concatenations (eg copy a.*+b.*+c.*) to work properly.
 26673                                  ;11/02/83 EE  Commented out the code in CPARSE which added drive designators
 26674                                  ;	     to tokens which begin with path characters so that PARSELINE
 26675                                  ;	     will work correctly.
 26676                                  ;11/04/83 EE  Commented out the code in CPARSE that considered paren's to be
 26677                                  ;	     individual tokens. That distinction is no longer needed for
 26678                                  ;	     FOR loop processing.
 26679                                  ;11/17/83 EE  CPARSE upper case conversion is now flag dependent. Flag is
 26680                                  ;	     1 when Cparse is called from COPY.
 26681                                  ;11/17/83 EE  Took out the comment chars around code described in 11/04/83
 26682                                  ;	     mod. It now is conditional on flag like previous mod.
 26683                                  ;11/21/83 NP  Added printf
 26684                                  ;12/09/83 EE  CPARSE changed to use CPYFLAG to determine when a colon should
 26685                                  ;	     be added to a token.
 26686                                  ;05/30/84 MZ  Initialize all copy variables. Fix confusion with destclosed
 26687                                  ;	     NOTE: DestHand is the destination handle. There are two
 26688                                  ;	     special values: -1 meaning destination was never opened and
 26689                                  ;	     0 which means that the destination has been openned and
 26690                                  ;	     closed.
 26691                                  ;06/01/84 MZ  Above reasoning totally specious. Returned things to normal
 26692                                  ;06/06/86 EG  Change to fix problem of source switches /a and /b getting
 26693                                  ;	     lost on large and multiple file (wildcard) copies.
 26694                                  ;06/09/86 EG  Change to use xnametrans call to verify that source and
 26695                                  ;	     destination are not equal.
 26696                                  ;
 26697                                  ;06/24/90 DO  If the destination of a file concatenation is the same as
 26698                                  ;	     first source file AND we run out of disk space before
 26699                                  ;	     completing the concatenation, restore the first source
 26700                                  ;	     file as best we can. See SeekEnd and CopErr. Bug #859.
 26701                                  ;
 26702                                  ;M031 SR 10/11/90  Bug #3069. Use deny write sharing mode to open files
 26703                                  ;		instead of compatibility mode. This gives lesser sharing

 26859                                  	;	Disallow "copy file1+" as file overwriting itself.

 27573                                  	;	We are called to close the destination.
 27574                                  	;	We need to note whether or not there is any internal data left
 27575                                  	;	to be flushed out.
 27576

 27583                                  ;
 27584                                  ;M048 -- TryFlush changes the state of ConCat flag. So, before we append a
 27585                                  ;^Z, let's always flush out. This way if the ConCat flag changes, we will
 27586                                  ;just return without appending a ^Z incorrectly for the first file (since we
 27587                                  ;are concatenating now). Also, in case it is a single file copy, we will
 27588                                  ;anyway write the ^Z out separately. The only drawback is that there is a
 27589                                  ;performance overhead on single ASCII file copies which now always involve
 27590                                  ;2 writes instead of 1 before. Is this really that important?
 27591                                  ;
 27592                                  ;M048;	cmp	bx,[BYTCNT]		; is memory full?
 27593                                  ;M048;	jne	short PutZ

 27856                                  ;
 27857                                  ;	Inputs:

 28206                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 28207                                  
 28208                                  ;***	SetAsc - set Ascii, Binary, Inexact flags based on switches
 28209                                  ;
 28210                                  ;	Given switch vector in AX,
 28211                                  ;	  Set Ascii flag if /a is set
 28212                                  ;	  Clear Ascii flag if /b is set
 28213                                  ;	  Binary set if /b specified
 28214                                  ;	  Leave Ascii unchanged if neither or both are set
 28215                                  ; 	Also sets Inexact if Ascii is ever set. 
 28216                                  ;	AL = Ascii on exit, flags set
 28217                                  
 28218                                  	; 26/03/2023
 28219                                  SETASC:
 28220                                  	;and	al,SWITCHA+SWITCHB ; 0Ch ; AL = /a, /b flags
 28221 00003ED1 240C                    	and	al,0Ch ; 4+8
 28222 00003ED3 7A10                    	jpe	short LOADSW	; even parity - both or neither
 28223 00003ED5 50                      	push	ax
 28224                                  	;and	al,SWITCHB  ; 8
 28225 00003ED6 2408                    	and	al,8
 28226 00003ED8 A2[698D]                	mov	[BINARY],al
 28227 00003EDB 58                      	pop	ax
 28228                                  	;and	al,SWITCHA
 28229 00003EDC 2404                    	and	al,4	
 28230 00003EDE A2[6D8D]                	mov	[ASCII],al
 28231 00003EE1 0806[678D]              	or	[INEXACT],al
 28232                                  LOADSW:
 28233 00003EE5 A0[6D8D]                	mov	al,[ASCII]
 28234 00003EE8 08C0                    	or	al,al
 28235 00003EEA C3                      	retn

 28240                                  BUILDDEST:
 28241 00003EEB 803E[4C8C]FF            	cmp	byte [DestIsDir],-1 ; 0FFh

 28288                                  
 28289                                  ;*	Figure out what copy mode we're in.
 28290                                  ;	Letters stand for unambiguous, * for ambiguous pathnames.
 28291                                  ;	+n stands for additional sources delimited by +'s.
 28292                                  ;
 28293                                  ;	copy a b	not concatenating
 28294                                  ;	copy a *	not concatenating
 28295                                  ;	copy * a	concatenating
 28296                                  ;	copy * *	not concatenating
 28297                                  ;	copy a+n b	concatenating
 28298                                  ;	copy *+n a	concatenating
 28299                                  ;	copy *+n *	concatenating, Mel Hallerman style
 28300                                  
 28301                                  ;	Bugbug:  copy *.a+a.b *.t  picks up only 1st *.a file.. Why?
 28302                                  ;		 copy a.b+*.a *.t  picks up all *.a files.
 28303                                  
 28304 00003F37 A0[508C]                	mov	al,[DestInfo]		; AL = destination CParse flags
 28305 00003F3A 8A26[B38C]              	mov	ah,[SrcInfo]		; AH = source CParse flags
 28306 00003F3E 250202                  	and	ax,202h			; AH,AL = source,dest wildcard flags
 28307 00003F41 08C0                    	or	al,al
 28308 00003F43 7413                    	jz	short NOTMELCOPY 	; no destination wildcard
 28309                                  
 28310                                  ;	Destination is wildcarded.
 28311                                  	
 28312 00003F45 38E0                    	cmp	al,ah
 28313 00003F47 750F                    	jnz	short NOTMELCOPY ; no source wildcard
 28314                                  
 28315                                  ;	Source and destination are both wildcarded.
 28316                                  
 28317 00003F49 803E[6E8D]00            	cmp	byte [PLUS],0
 28318 00003F4E 7408                    	jz	short NOTMELCOPY	; no +'s in source
 28319                                  
 28320                                  ;	Source and destination are wildcarded, and source includes +'s.
 28321                                  ;	It's Mel Hallorman copy time.
 28322                                  
 28323 00003F50 FE06[AC8C]              	inc	byte [MELCOPY]		; 'Mel copy' = true
 28324 00003F54 30C0                    	xor	al,al
 28325 00003F56 EB06                    	jmp	short SETCONC
 28326                                  
 28327                                  NOTMELCOPY:
 28328 00003F58 3402                    	xor	al,2			; AL=0 -> ambiguous destination, 2 otherwise
 28329 00003F5A 20E0                    	and	al,ah
 28330 00003F5C D0E8                    	shr	al,1			; AL=1 -> ambiguous source, unambiguous dest
 28331                                  					;   (implies concatenation)
 28332                                  SETCONC:
 28333 00003F5E 0A06[6E8D]              	or	al,[PLUS]		; "+" always infers concatenation
 28334                                  
 28335                                  ;	Whew. AL = 1 if concatenating, 0 if not.
 28336                                  
 28337 00003F62 A2[DA8A]                	mov	[Concat],al

 28339 00003F67 D0E0                    	shl	al,1

 28341 00003F6C 803E[698D]00            	cmp	byte [BINARY],0
 28342 00003F71 7524                    	jne	short NOFIRSTDEST 	; explicit binary copy	
 28343                                  
 28344 00003F73 A2[6D8D]                	mov	[ASCII],al		; otherwise, concatenate in ascii mode

 28346 00003F78 751D                    	jnz	short NOFIRSTDEST 	; Ascii flag set before, data read correctly

 28349                                  
 28350                                  ;	At this point there may already be binary read data in the read
 28351                                  ;	buffer. We need to find the first ^Z (if there is one) and trim the
 28352                                  ;	amount of data in the buffer correctly.
 28353                                  
 28354 00003F7E 8B0E[E88A]              	mov	cx,[NXTADD]
 28355 00003F82 E313                    	jcxz	NOFIRSTDEST		; no data, everything ok
 28356 00003F84 B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah
 28357 00003F86 06                      	push	es
 28358 00003F87 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 28359 00003F89 8E06[C78A]              	mov	es,[TPA]

 28725                                  ;============================================================================
 28726                                  ; CPARSE.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 28727                                  ;============================================================================
 28728                                  ; 30/09/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 28729                                  ; 28/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 28730                                  
 28731                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------;
 28732                                  ; ENTRY:								;
 28733                                  ;	DS:SI	Points input buffer					;
 28734                                  ;	ES:DI	Points to the token buffer				;
 28735                                  ;	BL	Special delimiter for this call 			;
 28736                                  ;		    Always checked last 				;
 28737                                  ;		    set it to space if there is no special delimiter	;
 28738                                  ; EXIT: 								;
 28739                                  ;	DS:SI	Points to next char in the input buffer 		;
 28740                                  ;	ES:DI	Points to the token buffer				;
 28741                                  ;	[STARTEL] Points to start of last element of path in token	;
 28742                                  ;		points to a NUL for no element strings 'd:' 'd:/'       ;
 28743                                  ;	CX	Character count 					;
 28744                                  ;	BH	Condition Code						;
 28745                                  ;			Bit 1H of BH set if switch character		;
 28746                                  ;				Token buffer contains char after	;
 28747                                  ;				switch character			;
 28748                                  ;				BP has switch bits set (ORing only)	;
 28749                                  ;			Bit 2H of BH set if ? or * in token		;
 28750                                  ;				if * found element ? filled		;
 28751                                  ;			Bit 4H of BH set if path sep in token		;
 28752                                  ;			Bit 80H of BH set if the special delimiter	;
 28753                                  ;			   was skipped at the start of this token	;
 28754                                  ;		Token buffer always starts d: for non switch tokens	;
 28755                                  ;	CARRY SET							;
 28756                                  ;	    if CR on input						;
 28757                                  ;		token buffer not altered				;
 28758                                  ;									;
 28759                                  ;	DOES NOT RETURN ON BAD PATH, OR TRAILING SWITCH CHAR ERROR	;
 28760                                  ; MODIFIES:								;
 28761                                  ;	CX, SI, AX, BH, DX and the Carry Flag				;
 28762                                  ;									;
 28763                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------;
 28764                                  
 28765                                  ; Modifications to cparse: recognition of right and left parentheses
 28766                                  ; as integral tokens, and removal of automatic upper-case conversion code.
 28767                                  ;
 28768                                  ; Both modifications were installed in the course of adding a coherent
 28769                                  ; command-line parser to COMMAND.COM which builds a UNIX-style argv[]/argc
 28770                                  ; structure for command-line arguments. This parser relies on cparse to
 28771                                  ; recognize individual tokens.
 28772                                  ;
 28773                                  ; To process for-loops correctly, parentheses must therefore be
 28774                                  ; recognized as tokens. The upper-case conversion code was removed so
 28775                                  ; that commands (such as for and echo) would be able to use the "original"
 28776                                  ; text of the command line.
 28777                                  ;
 28778                                  ; Note also the modification to prevent the automatic conversion of colons
 28779                                  ; into spaces WITHIN THE SOURCE TEXT!
 28780                                  ;
 28781                                  ; Also note that BP is also clobbered if cparse recognizes any switches
 28782                                  ; on the command line.
 28783                                  ;
 28784                                  ; Alan L, OS/MSDOS				    14 August 1983
 28785                                  
 28786                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28787

 28789

 28796

 28800                                  cparse:
 28801 00004159 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 28802 0000415B 893E[7B8D]              	mov	[STARTEL],di		; No path element (Is DI correct?)
 28803 0000415F A2[7E8D]                	mov	[ELPOS],al		; Start in 8 char prefix
 28804                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 28805                                  	;mov	[SOURCE],al		
 28806                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28807 00004162 A2[7F8D]                	mov	[SKPDEL], al		; No skip delimiter yet

 28811 00004169 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			; no chars in token buffer

 28813                                  moredelim:

 28815 00004170 E873E4                  	call	DELIM
 28816 00004173 751D                    	jnz	short SCANCDONE

 28818 00004177 74F6                    	jz	short moredelim
 28819 00004179 3C09                    	cmp	al,9
 28820 0000417B 74F2                    	jz	short moredelim
 28821                                  	;xchg	al,[SOURCE]
 28822                                  	; 28/03/2023
 28823 0000417D 8606[7F8D]              	xchg	al,[SKPDEL]
 28824 00004181 08C0                    	or	al,al
 28825 00004183 74EA                    	jz	short moredelim		; One non space/tab delimiter allowed
 28826 00004185 F6C780                  	test	bh,80h			; has a special char been found?
 28827 00004188 7405                    	jz	short no_comma		; no - just exit

 28829                                  no_comma:
 28830 0000418F E92A01                  	jmp	x_done			; Nul argument
 28831                                  
 28832                                  SCANCDONE:
 28833                                  	; 28/03/2023
 28834                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28835                                  	; -----------------------------------
 28836                                  	; Mod to avoid upper-case conversion.
 28837                                  	; -----------------------------------
 28838                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 28839                                  	;cmp	byte [CPYFLAG],1	; 3/3/KK
 28840                                  	;jnz	short cpcont1		; 3/3/KK

 28843                                  	; -----------------------------------
 28844                                  	; 28/03/2023

 28846 00004194 7505                    	jne	short nospec

 28848 00004199 EBD4                    	jmp	short moredelim
 28849                                  nospec:
 28850 0000419B 3C0D                    	cmp	al,0Dh			; a CR?

 28852 0000419F E91501                  	jmp	cperror
 28853                                  ncperror:
 28854 000041A2 3A06[C98A]              	cmp	al,[SWITCHAR]		; is the char the switch char?
 28855 000041A6 7503                    	jne	short na_switch		; yes, process...
 28856 000041A8 E91401                  	jmp	a_switch
 28857                                  na_switch:
 28858 000041AB B23A                    	mov	dl,':'
 28859 000041AD 3814                    	cmp	[si],dl
 28860 000041AF 751D                    	jne	short anum_chard	; Drive not specified
 28861                                  	; 28/03/2023
 28862                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 28864 000041B6 7503                    	jne	short cpcont2		; 3/3/KK
 28865 000041B8 E82EE2                  	call	UPCONV			; 3/3/KK
 28866                                  cpcont2:

 28868 000041BE AC                      	lodsb				; Get the ':'
 28869 000041BF E85501                  	call	move_char

 28871 000041C6 C606[7D8D]00            	mov	byte [ELCNT],0

 28990                                  	; 28/03/2023

 28993                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28994 00004297 7403                    	je	short FOO15
 28995 00004299 E95FFF                  	jmp	anum_char
 28996                                  
 28997                                  ; Modification made for parseline.
 28998                                  ; Why would it be necessary to change colons to spaces? In this
 28999                                  ; case, EVERY colon is changed to a space; e.g., 'f:' yields 'f ',
 29000                                  ; but so does 'echo foo:bar' yield 'echo foo bar'.
 29001

 29058                                  a_switch_notkanj:			;AN057;
 29059 000042DC 3C0D                    	cmp	al,0Dh
 29060 000042DE 7509                    	jne	short Store_swt

 29064 000042E3 81CD0040                	or	bp,4000h

 29066                                  					;   BP = fSwitch but no switch
 29067                                  					;   bit is set (unknown switch)
 29068                                  Store_swt:

 29070                                  
 29071                                  ; This upconv call must stay. It is used to identify copy-switches
 29072                                  ; on the command line, and won't store anything into the output buffer.
 29073                                  
 29074                                  	;call	UPCONV_MAPCALL ; MSDOS 3.3 (Retro DOS 3.0)
 29075                                  	; 28/03/2023
 29076 000042EC E8FAE0                  	call	UPCONV 	; MSDOS 6.0 & MSDOS 5.0 (Retro DOS 4.0)
 29077                                  	
 29078 000042EF 06                      	push	es
 29079 000042F0 57                      	push	di
 29080 000042F1 51                      	push	cx
 29081 000042F2 0E                      	push	cs
 29082 000042F3 07                      	pop	es
 29083                                  	; 28/03/2023
 29084                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 29085                                  	;mov	di,SWITCH_LIST ; "VBAPW"
 29086                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 29087 000042F4 BF[5184]                	mov	di,switch_list ; "?VBAPW"
 29088                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 29089                                  	;mov	cx,SWCOUNT ; 5
 29090                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 29091 000042F7 B90600                  	mov	cx,6  ; SWCOUNT = 6
 29092                                  	;or	bp,FBADSWITCH  ; 4000h
 29093 000042FA 81CD0040                	or	bp,4000h
 29094 000042FE F2AE                    	repne	scasb
 29095 00004300 750B                    	jnz	short out_tokenp
 29096                                  	;and	bp,~FBADSWITCH ; 0BFFFh
 29097 00004302 81E5FFBF                	and	bp,0BFFFh
 29098 00004306 B80100                  	mov	ax,1
 29099 00004309 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 29100 0000430B 09C5                    	or	bp,ax
 29101                                  out_tokenp:
 29102 0000430D 59                      	pop	cx
 29103 0000430E 5F                      	pop	di
 29104 0000430F 07                      	pop	es
 29105                                  out_token:
 29106 00004310 B000                    	mov	al,0			; null at the end
 29107 00004312 AA                      	stosb
 29108 00004313 5F                      	pop	di			; restore token buffer pointer	
 29109 00004314 9D                      	popf
 29110 00004315 F8                      	clc				; clear carry flag
 29111 00004316 C3                      	retn
 29112

 29114                                  
 29115                                  	; 28/03/2023
 29116                                  move_char:
 29117 00004317 AA                      	stosb				; store char in token buffer
 29118 00004318 41                      	inc	cx			; increment char count
 29119 00004319 FE06[7D8D]              	inc	byte [ELCNT]		; increment element count for * substi
 29120 0000431D C3                      	retn

 29132                                  ;-------- Character code definition

 29134                                  $P_DBSP1	   equ	20h ; DB_SP_HI	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS blank
 29135                                  $P_DBSP2	   equ	20h ; DB_SP_LO	;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS blank
 29136                                  $P_Period	   equ	"."             ;AN020;
 29137                                  $P_Slash	   equ	"/"             ;AN020;
 29138                                  $P_Space	   equ	" "             ;AN000; SBCS blank
 29139                                  $P_Comma	   equ	","             ;AN000;
 29140                                  $P_Switch	   equ	"/"             ;AN000;
 29141                                  $P_Keyword	   equ	"="             ;AN000;
 29142                                  $P_Colon	   equ	":"             ;AN000;
 29143                                  $P_Plus 	   equ	"+"             ;AN000;
 29144                                  $P_Minus	   equ	"-"             ;AN000;
 29145                                  $P_Rparen	   equ	")"             ;AN000;
 29146                                  $P_Lparen	   equ	"("             ;AN000;
 29147                                  ;(deleted ;AN025;) $P_SQuote equ  "'"
 29148                                  $P_DQuote	   equ	'"'             ;AN000;
 29149                                  $P_NULL 	   equ	0		;AN000;
 29150                                  $P_TAB		   equ	9		;AN000;
 29151                                  $P_CR		   equ	0Dh		;AN000;
 29152                                  $P_LF		   equ	0Ah		;AN000;
 29153                                  $P_ASCII80	   equ	80h		;AN000; ASCII 80h character code
 29154                                  
 29155                                  $P_DOSTBL_File	   equ	4		;AN000; get file uppercase table
 29156                                  $P_DOSTBL_Char	   equ	2		;AN000; get character uppercase table
 29157                                  
 29158                                  $P_error_filespec  equ  1
 29159                                  
 29160                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29161                                  ; PARMS LABEL	BYTE
 29162                                  ;	DW	PARMSX
 29163                                  ;	DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 29164                                  ;	DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 29165                                  ;	DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 29166                                  ;				; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 29167                                  ;				; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 29168                                  ;	DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 29169                                  ;	DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 29170                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29171                                  
 29172                                  struc $P_PARMS_BLK			;AN000;
 29173 00000000 ????                    .$P_PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 29174 00000002 ??                      .$P_Num_Extra:	     resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 29175 00000003 ??                      .$P_Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 29176                                  endstruc 				;AN000;
 29177                                  
 29178                                  $P_Len_PARMS	   equ	4		;AN000;
 29179                                  $P_I_Use_Default   equ	0		;AN000; no extra stuff specified
 29180                                  $P_I_Have_Delim    equ	1		;AN000; extra delimiter specified
 29181                                  $P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 29182                                  
 29183                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29184                                  ; PARMSX LABEL	BYTE
 29185                                  ;	DB	minp,maxp		; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED
 29186                                  ;	DW	CONTROL 		; DESCRIPTION OF POSITIONAL 1
 29187                                  ;	:				; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 29188                                  ;	DB	maxs			; # OF SWITCHES
 29189                                  ;	DW	CONTROL 		; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 29190                                  ;	:				; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES
 29191                                  ;	DB	maxk			; # OF KEYWORD
 29192                                  ;	DW	CONTROL 		; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 29193                                  ;	:				; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 29194                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29195                                  
 29196                                  struc $P_PARMSX_BLK			;AN000;
 29197 00000000 ??                      .$P_MinP: 	 resb 1	 ; 27/04/2023	;AN000; Minimum positional number
 29198 00000001 ??                      .$P_MaxP: 	 resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 29199 00000002 ??                      .$P_1st_Control: resb 1			;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 29200                                  endstruc				;AN000;
 29201                                  
 29202                                  ; 31/03/2023
 29203                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29204                                  ; << Control field definition >>
 29205                                  ;
 29206                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 29207                                  ;	   DW MATCH_FLAGS	; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 29208                                  ;				; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 29209                                  ;				; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 29210                                  ;				; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 29211                                  ;				; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 29212                                  ;				; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 29213                                  ;				; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 29214                                  ;				; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 29215                                  ;				; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 29216                                  ;				; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 29217                                  ;				; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 29218                                  ;				; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 29219                                  ;				; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 29220                                  ;	   DW FUNCTION_FLAGS
 29221                                  ;				; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 29222                                  ;				; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 29223                                  ;				; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 29224                                  ; (tm10)			; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 29225                                  ;
 29226                                  ;	   DW RESULT		; RESULT BUFFER
 29227                                  ;	   DW VALUES		; VALUE LISTS
 29228                                  ;	   DB nid		; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 29229                                  ;	   DB "...",0		; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 29230                                  ;	   :
 29231                                  ;
 29232                                  ;Note:
 29233                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 29234                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 29235                                  ;
 29236                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 29237                                  ;
 29238                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 29239                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 29240                                  ;
 29241                                  ;
 29242                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 29243                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 29244                                  ;
 29245                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 29246                                  ;
 29247                                  ;
 29248                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 29249                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 29250                                  ;
 29251                                  ;		DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 29252                                  ;		DB   '/A',0
 29253                                  ;
 29254                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 29255                                  ;
 29256                                  ;		DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 29257                                  ;		DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 29258                                  ;
 29259                                  ;
 29260                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 29261                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 29262                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 29263                                  ;
 29264                                  ;
 29265                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 29266                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 29267                                  ;
 29268                                  ;		DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 29269                                  ;		DB    '/A',0
 29270                                  ;		DB    '/B',0
 29271                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29272                                  
 29273                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 29274                                  
 29275                                  $P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 29276                                  $P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 29277                                  $P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 29278                                  $P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 29279                                  $P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 29280                                  $P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 29281                                  $P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 29282                                  $P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 29283                                  $P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 29284                                  $P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 29285                                  $P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 29286                                  $P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 29287                                  
 29288                                  ;**** Function flags
 29289                                  
 29290                                  $P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 29291                                  $P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 29292                                  $P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 29293                                  $P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 29294

 29297 00000000 ????                    .$P_Match_Flag:	   resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched

 29299 00000004 ????                    .$P_Result_Buf:	   resw 1		;AN000; Result buffer address
 29300 00000006 ????                    .$P_Value_List:	   resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 29301 00000008 ??                      .$P_nid:	   resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 29302 00000009 ??                      .$P_KEYorSW:	   resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 29303                                  endstruc

 29305                                  ; 31/03/2023
 29306                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29307                                  ;
 29308                                  ;VALUES LABEL	BYTE
 29309                                  ;	DB	nval		; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 29310                                  ;	+-
 29311                                  ;	| DB	nrng		; NUMBER OF RANGES
 29312                                  ;	| +DB	ITEM_TAG	; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 29313                                  ;	| +DD	X,Y		; RANGE OF VALUES
 29314                                  ;	|	:
 29315                                  ;	| DB	nnval		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 29316                                  ;	| +DB	ITEM_TAG	; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 29317                                  ;	| +DD	VALUE		; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 29318                                  ;	|	:
 29319                                  ;	| DB	nstrval 	; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 29320                                  ;	| +DB	ITEM_TAG	; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 29321                                  ;	| +DW	STRING		; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 29322                                  ;	+-	:
 29323                                  ;
 29324                                  ;STRING DB	"...",0		; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 29325                                  ;
 29326                                  ;Note:
 29327                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 29328                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 29329                                  ;
 29330                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 29331                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 29332                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 29333                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29334                                  
 29335                                  $P_nval_None	equ 0		;AN000; no value list ID
 29336                                  $P_nval_Range	equ 1		;AN000; range list ID
 29337                                  $P_nval_Value	equ 2		;AN000; value list ID
 29338                                  $P_nval_String	equ 3		;AN000; string list ID
 29339                                  $P_Len_Range	equ 9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 29340                                  $P_Len_Value	equ 5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 29341                                  $P_Len_String	equ 3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 29342                                  $P_No_nrng	equ 0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 29343                                  
 29344                                  struc $P_VAL_LIST
 29345 00000000 ??                      .$P_NumofList:	resb 1		;AN000; number of following choice
 29346 00000001 ????                    .$P_Val_XL:	resw 1		;AN000; lower word of value
 29347 00000003 ????                    .$P_Val_XH:	resw 1		;AN000; higher word of value
 29348 00000005 ????                    .$P_Val_YL:	resw 1		;AN000; lower word of another value
 29349 00000007 ????                    .$P_Val_YH:	resw 1		;AN000; higher word of another value
 29350                                  endstruc
