 29352                                  ; 31/03/2023
 29353                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29354                                  ;
 29355                                  ;RESULT LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 29356                                  ;	DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 29357                                  ;					;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 29358                                  ;					;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 29359                                  ;					;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 29360                                  ;					;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 29361                                  ;					;	9=QUOTED STRING
 29362                                  ;	DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 29363                                  ;
 29364                                  ;	dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 29365                                  ;
 29366                                  ;       +-
 29367                                  ;       | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 29368                                  ;       | or
 29369                                  ;       |	DW i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 29370                                  ;       |				; (ES presents Segment address)
 29371                                  ;       | or
 29372                                  ;       |	DD STRING		; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 29373                                  ;       | or
 29374                                  ;       |	DB drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 29375                                  ;       | or
 29376                                  ;       |	DW YEAR	   		;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 29377                                  ;       |	DB MONTH   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 29378                                  ;       |	DB DATE	   ;(1-31)	 0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 29379                                  ;       | or
 29380                                  ;       |	DB HOUR	   ;(0-23)	 IN CASE OF TIME
 29381                                  ;       |	DB MINUTES    ;(0-59)	 Note: Range check is not performed .
 29382                                  ;       |	DB SECONDS    ;(0-59)	 0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 29383                                  ;       |	DB HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 29384                                  ;       +-
 29385                                  ;
 29386                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 29387                                  ;      list.
 29388                                  ;
 29389                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 29390                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it. For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 29391                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 29392                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29393

 29490                                  ; ----------------------------
 29491                                  
 29492                                  ;***********************************************************************
 29493                                  ; SysParse;
 29494                                  ;
 29495                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 29496                                  ;
 29497                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 29498                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 29499                                  ;	  psdata_seg -> psdata.inc
 29500                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 29501                                  ;
 29502                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 29503                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 29504                                  ;		 is in DS.
 29505                                  ;
 29506                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 29507                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 29508                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 29509                                  ;
 29510                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 29511                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 29512                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 29513                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 29514                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 29515                                  ;
 29516                                  ; Use:	$P_Skip_Delim, $P_Chk_EOL, $P_Chk_Delim, $P_Chk_DBCS
 29517                                  ;	$P_Chk_Swtch, $P_Chk_Pos_Control, $P_Chk_Key_Control
 29518                                  ;	$P_Chk_Sw_Control, $P_Fill_Result
 29519                                  ;
 29520                                  ; Vars: $P_Ordinal(RW), $P_RC(RW), $P_SI_Save(RW), $P_DX(R), $P_Terminator(R)
 29521                                  ;	$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), $P_Flags(RW), $P_Found_SYNONYM(R), $P_Save_EOB(W)
 29522                                  ;
 29523                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 29524                                  ;
 29525                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 29526                                  ;  4/28/87 : $P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 29527                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 29528                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 29529                                  ;  6/12/87 : $P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 29530                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 29531                                  ;  6/12/87 : $P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 29532                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 29533                                  ;  6/12/87 : $P_FileSp_Char and $P_FileSP_Len are missing
 29534                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 29535                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 29536                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 29537                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add $P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 29538                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 29539                                  ;	     (tm08)
 29540                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 29541                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 29542                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag $P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 29543                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 29544                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 29545                                  ;	     in user's routines. $P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 29546                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 29547                                  ;					  (tm12)

 29551                                  ;					  (tm14)

 29553                                  ;					  (tm15)

 29555                                  ;
 29556                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 29557                                  ;

 29559                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 29560                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 29561                                  ;	     affected: $P_Chk_SW_Control.

 29564                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 29565                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 29566                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.

 29570                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC $P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 29571                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 29572                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 29573                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change $P_Chk_Switch to allow
 29574                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 29575                                  ;
 29576                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 29577                                  ;	     In PROC $P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 29578                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 29579                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 29580                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 29581                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 29582                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 29583                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 29584                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 29585                                  ;
 29586                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 29587                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 29588                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 29589                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 29590                                  ;	     segment.
 29591                                  ;

 29594                                  ;	     into PUSH PSDATA_SEG.  In $P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020

 29617                                  ;	     one quote character, but is reported as two quotes.  This changed

 30147                                  ; $P_Fill_Result
 30148                                  ;
 30149                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 30150                                  ;
 30151                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 30152                                  ;	    AL = type
 30153                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 30154                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 30155                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 30156                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 30157                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has secondsn,
 30158                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 30159                                  ;		  AL = else: psdata_seg:SI points to returned string buffer
 30160                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block

 30162                                  ; Output:   None

 31853                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 31854                                  ;
 31855                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of End of Line characters
 31856                                  ;***********************************************************************

 31891                                  ;***********************************************************************
 31892                                  ; $P_Chk_Delim;
 31893                                  ;
 31894                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 31895                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 31896                                  ;	    blanks.

 31913                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space

 31975                                  ;***********************************************************************
 31976                                  ; $P_Chk_Switch;
 31977                                  ;
 31978                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 31979                                  ;	    $P_STRING_BUF
 31980                                  ;
 31981                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 31982                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within $P_String_Buf
 31983                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 31984                                  ;
 31985                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 31986                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 31987                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 31988                                  ;
 31989                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 31990                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 31991                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 31992                                  ;
 31993                                  ; Vars:  $P_Terminator(W)
 31994                                  ;
 31995                                  ; Use:	 $P_0099
 31996                                  ;***********************************************************************
 31997                                  
 31998                                  	; 06/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 31999                                  
 32000                                  $P_Chk_Switch:
 32001                                  	; 18/04/2023
 32002 00004D59 8D2E[2786]              	lea	bp,$P_STRING_BUF	;AN020;AC034; BP=OFFSET of $P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 32003                                  
 32004 00004D5D 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 32005 00004D5F 7418                    	je	short $P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 32006                                  
 32007 00004D61 3C2F                    	cmp     al,$P_Switch ; '/'	;AN000;
 32008 00004D63 7512                    	jne	short $P_STRUC_L5	;AN000;
 32009                                  
 32010 00004D65 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash, now see if might be in date string
 32011 00004D66 50                      	push	ax			;AN020;save input char
 32012 00004D67 2E8A47FF                	mov	al,[cs:bx-1]		;AN026;AL=char before the current char
 32013 00004D6B E804FB                  	call	$P_0099 		;AN020;return carry set if not numeric
 32014 00004D6E 7205                    	jc	short $P_STRUC_L7	;AN000;
 32015

 32017 00004D72 E8FDFA                  	call	$P_0099			;AN020;return carry set if not numeric
 32018                                  $P_STRUC_L7:				;AN000;

 32020                                  	;jmp	short $P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 32021                                  	; 18/04/2023
 32022 00004D76 C3                      	retn
 32023

 32069 00004D8F 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 32070 00004D90 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 32071 00004D91 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 32072 00004D92 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 32073 00004D93 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 32074 00004D94 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 32075 00004D95 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 32076 00004D96 31F6                    	xor	si,si			;AN000;
 32077 00004D98 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si			;AN000;
 32078                                  	;mov	ax,$P_DOS_GetEV 	;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 32079 00004D9A B80063                  	mov	ax,6300h
 32080 00004D9D CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 32081 00004D9F 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 32082 00004DA1 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 32083 00004DA3 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 32084 00004DA4 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 32085 00004DA5 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 32086 00004DA6 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 32087 00004DA7 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 32088 00004DA8 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 32089 00004DA9 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 32090 00004DAA 7429                    	jz	short $P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 32091                                  $P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 32092 00004DAC 2E8936[1986]            	mov	[cs:$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset

 32100 00004DC5 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;

 32102 00004DC9 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of

 32108 00004DD2 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg

 32154                                  
 32155                                  ;============================================================================
 32156                                  ; NPRINTF.ASM, PRINTF.ASM, MSDOS 3.3, 1987
 32157                                  ;============================================================================
 32158                                  ; 30/09/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 32159                                  
 32160                                  ; BREAK	<Message Printing Routine>
 32161                                  
 32162                                  ;
 32163                                  ;	MSDOS V3.00 PRINT
 32164                                  ;
 32165                                  ;	Message Printing Routine
 32166                                  ;
 32167                                  
 32168                                  ;PRINTF.ASM (MSDOS 3.3, LIBC)
 32169                                  ;
 32170                                  ;TITLE   PRINTF ROUTINE FOR MS-DOS
 32171                                  ;
 32172                                  ; PRINTF(Control String, arg1, arg2,...,argn-1,argn)
 32173                                  ;
 32174                                  ; Characters are output to PFHandle according to the
 32175                                  ; specifications contained in the Control String.
 32176                                  ;
 32177                                  ; The conversion characters are as follow:
 32178                                  ;
 32179                                  ;               %c - output the next argument as a character
 32180                                  ;               %s - output the next argument as a string
 32181                                  ;               %x - output the next argument as a hexidecimal number
 32182                                  ;                    using abcedf
 32183                                  ;               %X - output the next argument as a hexidecimal number
 32184                                  ;                    using ABCDEF
 32185                                  ;               %d - output the next argument as a decimal number
 32186                                  ;
 32187                                  ;
 32188                                  ; Other format specifiers that may precede the conversion character are:
 32189                                  ;
 32190                                  ;               - (minus sign) - causes the field to be left-adjusted
 32191                                  ;               + (plus sign)  - causes the field to be right-adjusted (default)
 32192                                  ;               n - digit specifing the minimum field width (default to 1)
 32193                                  ;               L - specifing a long integer
 32194                                  ;
 32195                                  ;   On entry to PRINTF the stack contains the return address and a pointer
 32196                                  ;   to an argument list.
 32197                                  ;
 32198                                  ;   ____________________
 32199                                  ;   |   Ret Addr       |      <= SP
 32200                                  ;   --------------------
 32201                                  ;   |  Ptr to Arg List |
 32202                                  ;   --------------------
 32203                                  ;
 32204                                  ;   And the argument list contains the following:
 32205                                  ;
 32206                                  ;       String_ptr                  (a pointer to the control string)
 32207                                  ;       Arg 1
 32208                                  ;       Arg 2
 32209                                  ;         .
 32210                                  ;         .
 32211                                  ;         .
 32212                                  ;       Arg n-1
 32213                                  ;       Arg n
 32214                                  ;
 32215                                  ;   If the argument is a %s or %c the arg contains a pointer to the string
 32216                                  ;   or character.
 32217                                  ;
 32218                                  ;   The arguments are used in one-to-one correspondence to % specifiers.
 32219                                  
 32220                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 COMMAND.COM (1987) Transient portion offset 34E0h
 32221                                  
 32222                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 32223                                  
 32224                                  PRINTF_INIT:
 32225                                  	call	STD_PRINTF
 32226                                  	retf
 32227                                  
 32228                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 32229                                  
 32230                                  PRINTF_CRLF:
 32231                                  	call	STD_PRINTF
 32232                                  	;call	CRLF2
 32233                                  	;retn
 32234                                  	; 07/04/2023
 32235                                  	jmp	CRLF2
 32236                                  
 32237                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 32238                                  
 32239                                  STD_EPRINTF:
 32240                                  	mov	word [cs:PRINTF_HANDLE],2
 32241                                  	jmp	short new_printf
 32242                                  
 32243                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 32244                                  
 32245                                  STD_PRINTF:
 32246                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 COMMAND.COM (1987) Transient portion offset 34F4h
 32247                                  
 32248                                  	mov	word [cs:PRINTF_HANDLE],1
 32249                                  NEW_PRINTF:				;Save the callers' registers
 32250                                  	cld
 32251                                  	push	dx
 32252                                  	push	bp
 32253                                  	mov	bp,sp
 32254                                  	push	cx
 32255                                  	push	bx
 32256                                  	push	ax
 32257                                  	push	di
 32258                                  	push	si
 32259                                  	push	es
 32260                                  	push	ds
 32261                                  	push	cs
 32262                                  	pop	es		;ES points to Printf segment
 32263                                  	mov	di,PRINTF_BUF	;DI points to the output buffer
 32264                                  	mov	bp,[bp+2]  ; dx ;BP points to the argument list
 32265                                  	;mov	si,[ds:bp+0]	;SI points to the control string
 32266                                  	mov	si,[ds:bp] ; bp
 32267                                  	add	bp,2
 32268                                  	xor	bx,bx
 32269                                  	call	CLEAR_FLAGS	; initialize the world
 32270                                  
 32271                                  GET_CHAR:
 32272                                  	lodsb			;Get a character
 32273                                  	cmp	al,'%'		;Is it a conversion specifier?
 32274                                  	jz	short CONV_CHAR	;Yes - find out which one
 32275                                  	or	al,al		;Is it the end of the control string?
 32276                                  	jz	short PRINTF_DONE ;Yes - then we're done
 32277                                  PRINTF_PERCENT:				
 32278                                  	call	OUTCHR		;Otherwise store the character
 32279                                  	jmp	short GET_CHAR	;And go get another
 32280                                  
 32281                                  PRINTF_DONE:
 32282                                  	call	FLUSH
 32283                                  	pop	ds
 32284                                  	pop	es
 32285                                  	pop	si
 32286                                  	pop	di
 32287                                  	pop	ax
 32288                                  	pop	bx
 32289                                  	pop	cx
 32290                                  	pop	bp
 32291                                  	pop	dx
 32292                                  	retn
 32293                                  
 32294                                  CONV_CHAR:
 32295                                  	mov	byte [cs:PRINTF_LEFT],0
 32296                                  
 32297                                  NXT_CONV_CHAR:	
 32298                                  	;Look for any format specifiers preceeding the conversion character
 32299                                  	lodsb
 32300                                  	cmp	al,'%'			;Just print the %
 32301                                  	jz	short PRINTF_PERCENT
 32302                                  	cmp	al,[cs:CHAR_SUB] ; "-"	;Right justify the field	
 32303                                  	jz	short LEFT_ADJ
 32304                                  	cmp	al,[cs:PLUS_CHR] ; "+"	;Left justify the field
 32305                                  	jz	short CONV_CHAR
 32306                                  	cmp	al,[cs:CHAR_L]	 ; "L"	;Is it a long integer
 32307                                  	jz	short LONG_INT
 32308                                  	cmp	al,[cs:char_l]	 ; "l"		
 32309                                  	jz	short LONG_INT
 32310                                  	cmp	al,'0'			;Is it a precision specification
 32311                                  	jb	short LOOK_CONV_CHAR
 32312                                  	cmp	al,'9'
 32313                                  	ja	short LOOK_CONV_CHAR
 32314                                  	cmp	al,'0'
 32315                                  	jnz	short NOT_PAD
 32316                                  	cmp	word [cs:PRINTF_WIDTH],0
 32317                                  	jnz	short NOT_PAD
 32318                                  	mov	ah,'0'
 32319                                  	mov	[cs:PAD_CHAR],ah
 32320                                  NOT_PAD:					;Adjust decimal place on precision
 32321                                  	push	ax
 32322                                  	mov	ax,[cs:PRINTF_WIDTH]
 32323                                  	mov	cx,10
 32324                                  	mul	cx
 32325                                  	pop	dx
 32326                                  	xor	dh,dh
 32327                                  	sub	dl,'0'
 32328                                  	add	ax,dx
 32329                                  	mov	[cs:PRINTF_WIDTH],ax	;And save the total
 32330                                  	jmp	short NXT_CONV_CHAR
 32331                                  
 32332                                  LEFT_ADJ:
 32333                                  	mov	byte [cs:PRINTF_LEFT],1
 32334                                  	jmp	short NXT_CONV_CHAR
 32335                                  
 32336                                  LONG_INT:
 32337                                  	or	byte [cs:PRINTF_LONG],1
 32338                                  	jmp	short NXT_CONV_CHAR
 32339                                  
 32340                                  LOOK_CONV_CHAR:
 32341                                  	and	al,0DFh
 32342                                  	cmp	al,[cs:CHAR_X]	 ; "X"
 32343                                  	jz	short HEX_UP
 32344                                  	cmp	al,[cs:CHAR_D]	 ; "D"
 32345                                  	jz	short DECIMAL
 32346                                  	cmp	al,[cs:CHAR_C]	 ; "C"
 32347                                  	jz	short C_PUT_CHAR
 32348                                  	cmp	al,[cs:CHAR_S]	 ; "S"
 32349                                  	jz	short S_PUT_STRG
 32350                                  	call	CLEAR_FLAGS
 32351                                  	jmp	GET_CHAR
 32352                                  
 32353                                  HEX_UP:
 32354                                  	mov	word [cs:PRINTF_BASE],16 ;Hex conversion
 32355                                  	jmp	short CONV_TO_NUM
 32356                                  DECIMAL:
 32357                                  	mov	word [cs:PRINTF_BASE],10 ;Decimal conversion
 32358                                  	jmp	short CONV_TO_NUM
 32359                                  
 32360                                  C_PUT_CHAR:
 32361                                  	call	NEXT_CHRS
 32362                                  	mov	al,dl
 32363                                  	call	OUTCHR
 32364                                  	call	CLEAR_FLAGS
 32365                                  	jmp	GET_CHAR
 32366                                  
 32367                                  S_PUT_STRG:
 32368                                  	push	si			;Save pointer to control string
 32369                                  	call	NEXT_CHRS
 32370                                  	mov	si,dx
 32371                                  S_PUT_1:
 32372                                  	mov	cx,[cs:PRINTF_WIDTH]
 32373                                  	or	cx,cx
 32374                                  	jz	short S_PUT_2
 32375                                  	cmp	byte [cs:PRINTF_LEFT],0
 32376                                  	jnz	short S_PUT_2
 32377                                  	call	PAD_STRING
 32378                                  S_PUT_2:
 32379                                  	push	si
 32380                                  S_PUT_3:
 32381                                  	lodsb
 32382                                  	or	al,al
 32383                                  	jz	short S_PUT_4
 32384                                  	call	OUTCHR			;Put it into our buffer
 32385                                  	jmp	short S_PUT_3
 32386                                  S_PUT_4:
 32387                                  	pop	si
 32388                                  	cmp	byte [cs:PRINTF_LEFT],0
 32389                                  	jz	short C_S_END
 32390                                  	mov	cx,[cs:PRINTF_WIDTH]
 32391                                  	or	cx,cx
 32392                                  	jz	short C_S_END
 32393                                  	call	PAD_STRING
 32394                                  C_S_END:
 32395                                  	pop	si			;Restore control string pointer
 32396                                  	call	CLEAR_FLAGS
 32397                                  	jmp	GET_CHAR		;Go get another character	
 32398                                  
 32399                                  
 32400                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 32401                                  
 32402                                  PAD_STRING:
 32403                                  	xor	dx,dx
 32404                                  	push	si
 32405                                  
 32406                                  COUNT_LOOP:
 32407                                  	lodsb
 32408                                  	or	al,al
 32409                                  	jz	short COUNT_DONE
 32410                                  	inc	dx
 32411                                  	jmp	short COUNT_LOOP
 32412                                  
 32413                                  COUNT_DONE:
 32414                                  	pop	si
 32415                                  	sub	cx,dx
 32416                                  	jbe	short COUNT_RET
 32417                                  	call	PAD
 32418                                  
 32419                                  COUNT_RET:
 32420                                  	retn
 32421                                  
 32422                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32423                                  
 32424                                  CONV_TO_NUM:
 32425                                  	call	NEXT_CHRS
 32426                                  	mov	ax,dx
 32427                                  	xor	dx,dx
 32428                                  	cmp	byte [cs:PRINTF_LONG],0 
 32429                                  			;Is this is a short or long integer?
 32430                                  	jz	short NOT_LONG_INT
 32431                                  	call	NEXT_CHRS
 32432                                  
 32433                                  NOT_LONG_INT:
 32434                                  	push	bx
 32435                                  	push	si
 32436                                  	mov	si,[cs:PRINTF_BASE]
 32437                                  	mov	cx,[cs:PRINTF_WIDTH]
 32438                                  	call	PNUM
 32439                                  	pop	si
 32440                                  	pop	bx
 32441                                  	call	PAD
 32442                                  	call	CLEAR_FLAGS
 32443                                  	jmp	GET_CHAR
 32444                                  
 32445                                  
 32446                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 32447                                  
 32448                                  PNUM:
 32449                                  	dec	cx
 32450                                  	push	ax
 32451                                  	mov	ax,dx
 32452                                  	xor	dx,dx
 32453                                  	div	si
 32454                                  	mov	bx,ax
 32455                                  	pop	ax
 32456                                  	div	si
 32457                                  	xchg	bx,dx
 32458                                  	push	ax
 32459                                  	or	ax,dx
 32460                                  	pop	ax
 32461                                  	jz	short DO_PAD
 32462                                  	push	bx
 32463                                  	call	PNUM
 32464                                  	pop	bx
 32465                                  	jmp	short REM
 32466                                  
 32467                                  DO_PAD:
 32468                                  	cmp	byte [cs:PRINTF_LEFT],0
 32469                                  	jnz	short REM
 32470                                  	call	PAD
 32471                                  REM:
 32472                                  	cmp	bl,10
 32473                                  	jb	short NOT_HEX
 32474                                  	add	bx,6
 32475                                  NOT_HEX:
 32476                                  	mov	al,byte [cs:PRINTF_TABLE+bx] ; "0123456789ABCDEF"
 32477                                  	push	cx
 32478                                  	call	OUTCHR
 32479                                  	pop	cx
 32480                                  	retn
 32481                                  
 32482                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 32483                                  
 32484                                  PAD:
 32485                                  	or	cx,cx
 32486                                  	jle	short PAD_DONE
 32487                                  	mov	al,[cs:PAD_CHAR]
 32488                                  PAD_LOOP:
 32489                                  	push	cx
 32490                                  	call	OUTCHR
 32491                                  	pop	cx
 32492                                  	loop	PAD_LOOP
 32493                                  PAD_DONE:
 32494                                  	retn
 32495                                  
 32496                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 32497                                  
 32498                                  OUTCHR:
 32499                                  	stosb
 32500                                  	cmp	di,PRINTF_BUF_END ; SRCXNAME
 32501                                  	je	short FLUSH
 32502                                  OUTCHR_RETN:
 32503                                  	retn
 32504                                  
 32505                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 32506                                  
 32507                                  FLUSH:
 32508                                  	mov	cx,PRINTF_BUF
 32509                                  	xchg	cx,di
 32510                                  	sub	cx,di
 32511                                  	jz	short OUTCHR_RETN
 32512                                  WRITE_CHARS:
 32513                                  	push	bx
 32514                                  	mov	bx,[cs:PRINTF_HANDLE]
 32515                                  	push	ds
 32516                                  	push	cs
 32517                                  	pop	ds
 32518                                  	mov	dx,PRINTF_BUF
 32519                                  	mov	ah,Write ; 40h
 32520                                  	int	21h		; DOS -	2+ - WRITE TO FILE WITH	HANDLE
 32521                                  				; BX = file handle, CX = number	of bytes to write,
 32522                                  				; DS:DX -> buffer
 32523                                  	jnb	short FOOB2_1
 32524                                  	call	GET_EXT_ERR_NUMBER
 32525                                  	cmp	ax,6
 32526                                  	jz	short FOOB2_4
 32527                                  	jmp	short FOOB2_2
 32528                                  
 32529                                  FOOB2_1:
 32530                                  	cmp	cx,ax
 32531                                  	jz	short FOOB2_4
 32532                                  FOOB2_2:
 32533                                  	mov	bx,dx
 32534                                  	add	bx,ax
 32535                                  	cmp	byte [bx],1Ah
 32536                                  	jz	short FOOB2_4
 32537                                  	pop	ds
 32538                                  	pop	bx
 32539                                  	mov	es,[cs:RESSEG]
 32540                                  	mov	dx,NOSPACEPTR
 32541                                  	test	byte [es:PIPEFLAG],0FFh
 32542                                  	jz	short PRINT_ERR_EXIT
 32543                                  	call	PIPEOFF
 32544                                  	mov	dx,PIPEEMESPTR
 32545                                  PRINT_ERR_EXIT:	
 32546                                  	jmp	CERROR
 32547                                  
 32548                                  FOOB2_4:
 32549                                  	pop	ds
 32550                                  	pop	bx
 32551                                  	retn
 32552                                  
 32553                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 32554                                  
 32555                                  NEXT_CHRS:
 32556                                  	push	si		;Save pointer to control string
 32557                                  	mov	si,bx		;Get index into argument list
 32558                                  	add	bx,2		;Increment the index
 32559                                  	mov	si,[ds:bp+si]	; Get pointer to next argument
 32560                                  	mov	dx,[si]		; Get (address of the) next argument			
 32561                                  	pop	si
 32562                                  	retn
 32563                                  
 32564                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 32565                                  
 32566                                  CLEAR_FLAGS:
 32567                                  	xor	ax,ax
 32568                                  	mov	[cs:PRINTF_LEFT],al	;Reset justifing flag
 32569                                  	mov	[cs:PRINTF_LONG],al	;Reset long flag
 32570                                  	mov	[cs:PRINTF_WIDTH],ax	;Reinitialize width to 0
 32571                                  	mov	al,' '			
 32572                                  	mov	[cs:PAD_CHAR],al 	;Reset padding character
 32573                                  	retn
 32574

 32621                                  
 32622                                  ;****************************************************************
 32623                                  ;*
 32624                                  ;* ROUTINE:	STD_PRINTF/STD_EPRINTF
 32625                                  ;*
 32626                                  ;* FUNCTION:	Set up to print out a message using SYSDISPMSG.
 32627                                  ;*		Set up substitutions if utility message.  Make
 32628                                  ;*		sure any changes to message variables in TDATA
 32629                                  ;*		are reset to avoid reloading the transient.
 32630                                  ;*
 32631                                  ;* INPUT:	Msg_Disp_Class	-  set to message class
 32632                                  ;*		Msg_Cont_Flag	-  set to control flags
 32633                                  ;*		DS	points to transient segment
 32634                                  ;*
 32635                                  ;*		if utility message:
 32636                                  ;*		DX	points to a block with message number
 32637                                  ;*			(word), number of substitutions (byte),
 32638                                  ;*			followed by substitution list if there
 32639                                  ;*			are substitutions.  If substitutions
 32640                                  ;*			are not in transient segment they must
 32641                                  ;*			be set.
 32642                                  ;*		else
 32643                                  ;*		AX	set to message number
 32644                                  ;*
 32645                                  ;* OUTPUT:	none
 32646                                  ;*
 32647                                  ;****************************************************************
 32648                                  
 32649                                  std_eprintf:
 32650 00004DE7 C706[F187]0200          	mov	word [PRINTF_HANDLE],2 		;AC000;Print to STDERR
 32651 00004DED EB06                    	jmp	short new_printf		;AC000;
 32652                                  
 32653                                  	; 07/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 32654                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM (1991) Transient portion offset 5012h

 32696                                  
 32697                                  move_subst:

 32784                                  print_success:
 32785 00004E8C 5A                      	pop	dx				;AN061;restore dx
 32786 00004E8D 5E                      	pop	si				;AN000;restore registers
 32787 00004E8E 5F                      	pop	di				;AN000;
 32788 00004E8F 07                      	pop	es				;AN000;restore registers
 32789 00004E90 59                      	pop	cx				;AN000;
 32790 00004E91 5B                      	pop	bx				;AN000;
 32791 00004E92 58                      	pop	ax				;AN000;
 32792 00004E93 833E[BB8D]00            	cmp	word [print_err_flag],0		;AN000; if an error occurred - handle it
 32793 00004E98 7501                    	jnz	short print_err			;AN000;
 32794                                  
 32795 00004E9A C3                      	retn					;AC000;
 32796                                  
 32797                                  print_err:
 32798 00004E9B 0E                      	push	cs
 32799 00004E9C 07                      	pop	es
 32800 00004E9D 833E[F187]02            	cmp	word [PRINTF_HANDLE],2 		;AN026;Print to STDERR?
 32801 00004EA2 7503                    	jne	short not_stderr		;AN026;no - continue
 32802 00004EA4 E95DB2                  	jmp	TCOMMAND			;AN026;Yes - hopless - just exit
 32803                                  
 32804                                  not_stderr:
 32805 00004EA7 A1[BB8D]                	mov	ax,[print_err_flag]		;AN026;get extended error number back
 32806 00004EAA 8E06[C58A]              	mov	es,[RESSEG]			; No, set up for error, load the
 32807                                  						;  right error msg, and jmp to cerror.
 32808 00004EAE 26F606[0002]FF          	test	byte [es:PipeFlag],-1 ; 0FFh
 32809 00004EB4 7408                    	jz	short _go_to_error
 32810 00004EB6 E8B1E0                  	call	PipeOff
 32811 00004EB9 BA[7C80]                	mov	dx,PIPEEMES_PTR
 32812 00004EBC EB0B                    	jmp	short print_err_exit			;AC000;
 32813                                  
 32814                                  _go_to_error:
 32815 00004EBE C606[197F]01            	mov	byte [msg_disp_class],ext_msg_class
 32816                                  	;mov	byte [msg_disp_class],1		;AN000; set up extended error msg class
 32817 00004EC3 BA[1B7F]                	mov	dx,extend_buf_ptr		;AC000; get extended message pointer
 32818 00004EC6 A3[1B7F]                	mov	[extend_buf_ptr],ax		;AN000; get message number in control block
 32819                                  
 32820                                  print_err_exit: 				;AC000;
 32821 00004EC9 0E                      	push	cs
 32822 00004ECA 07                      	pop	es
 32823 00004ECB E984DA                  	jmp	cerror
 32824

 32872                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32873                                  ; MODULE NAME: MSGSERV.SAL
 32874                                  ;
 32875                                  ; DESCRIPTIVE NAME: Message Services SALUT file
 32876                                  ;
 32877                                  ; FUNCTION: This module incorporates all the messages services and
 32878                                  ;	    is called upon at build time to INCLUDE the code requested
 32879                                  ;	    by a utility. Code is requested using the macro MSG_SERVICES.
 32880                                  ;
 32881                                  ; ENTRY POINT: Since this a collection of subroutines, entry point is at
 32882                                  ;	    requested procedure.
 32883                                  ;
 32884                                  ; INPUT: Since this a collection of subroutines, input is dependent on
 32885                                  ;	    function requested.
 32886                                  ;
 32887                                  ; EXIT-NORMAL: In all cases, CARRY FLAG = 0
 32888                                  ;
 32889                                  ; EXIT-ERROR: In all cases, CARRY FLAG = 1
 32890                                  ;
 32891                                  ; INTERNAL REFERENCES: (list of included subroutines)
 32892                                  ;
 32893                                  ;	- SYSLOADMSG
 32894                                  ;	- SYSDISPMSG
 32895                                  ;	- SYSGETMSG
 32896                                  ;
 32897                                  ; EXTERNAL REFERENCES: None
 32898                                  ;
 32899                                  ; NOTES: At build time, some modules must be included. These are only included
 32900                                  ;	 once using assembler switches. Other logic is included at the request
 32901                                  ;	 of the utility.
 32902                                  ;
 32903                                  ;	 COMR and COMT are assembler switches to conditionally assemble code
 32904                                  ;	 for RESIDENT COMMAND.COM and TRANSIENT COMMAND.COM to reduce resident
 32905                                  ;	 storage and multiple EQUates.
 32906                                  ;
 32907                                  ; REVISION HISTORY: Created MAY 1987
 32908                                  ;
 32909                                  ;     Label: DOS - - Message Retriever
 32910                                  ;	     (c) Copyright 1988 Microsoft
 32911                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32912                                  
 32913                                  ;	Revision History
 32914                                  ;	================
 32915                                  ;
 32916                                  ;	M007	SR	08/24/90	Fixed bug #1818 -- changed
 32917                                  ;				$M_DISPLAY_H_STRING to properly
 32918                                  ;				handle Ctrl-Z being passed
 32919                                  ;
 32920                                  ;	M013	SR	9/12/90	Make SETSTDIO flag false so that all
 32921                                  ;				these routines are no longer assembled.
 32922                                  ;
 32923                                  ;	M016	SR	10/14/90	Bug #3380. Changed SYSLOADMSG so that
 32924                                  ;				CR-LF string also gets reinitialized
 32925                                  ;				on every cycle.
 32926                                  ;
 32927                                  ;	M020	SR	10/26/90	Bug #3380 again. Initialize $M_DIVISOR
 32928                                  ;				& $_MSG_NUM also in SYSLOADMSG.

 33222                                  ;;

 33225                                  ;;		IF MSG_NUM exists THEN
 33226                                  ;;		   Set DS:SI = MSG_TXT_PTR + 1

 33230                                  ;;		ENDIF

 33606                                  ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 33607                                  ;;
 33608                                  ;;  Proc Name:	SYSDISPMSG
 33609                                  ;;
 33610                                  ;;  Function:	The DISPLAY service will output a defined message to a handle
 33611                                  ;;		requested by the caller. It also provides function to display
 33612                                  ;;		messages when handles are not applicable (ie. DOS function calls
 33613                                  ;;		00h to 0Ah) Replaceable parameters are allowed and are
 33614                                  ;;		defined previous to entry.
 33615                                  ;;
 33616                                  ;;		It is assumes that a PRELOAD function has already determined
 33617                                  ;;		the addressibilty internally to the message retriever services.
 33618                                  ;;  Inputs:
 33619                                  ;;
 33620                                  ;;  Outputs:
 33621                                  ;;
 33622                                  ;;  Psuedocode:
 33623                                  ;;		Save registers needed later
 33624                                  ;;		Get address of the message requested
 33625                                  ;;		IF Message number exists THEN
 33626                                  ;;		  IF replacable parameters were specified THEN
 33627                                  ;;		     Display message with replacable parms
 33628                                  ;;		  ELSE
 33629                                  ;;		     Display string without replacable parms
 33630                                  ;;		  ENDIF
 33631                                  ;;		  IF character input was requested THEN
 33632                                  ;;		     Wait for character input
 33633                                  ;;		  ENDIF
 33634                                  ;;		  Clear CARRY FLAG
 33635                                  ;;		ELSE
 33636                                  ;;		   Set CARRY FLAG
 33637                                  ;;		ENDIF
 33638                                  ;;		Return
 33639                                  ;;
 33640                                  ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 33641                                  
 33642                                  	; 08/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM

 33682 000050E7 5F                      	pop	di				;;AN000;;
 33683                                  	;jmp	short $MEN97 ; ***
 33684                                  	; 08/04/2023
 33685                                  	;jmp	short $MEN93 ; **

 33874                                  ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 33875                                  ;;
 33876                                  ;; Scan_ctrlZ: This routine looks through the string to be printed and 
 33877                                  ;; truncates it at the Ctrl-Z if any present.
 33878                                  ;;
 33879                                  ;;	ENTRY:	ds:dx = String to be displayed
 33880                                  ;;		cx = number of chars to be displayed
 33881                                  ;;
 33882                                  ;;	EXIT:	cx = number of chars to be displayed
 33883                                  ;;
 33884                                  ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 33885                                  
 33886                                  	; 08/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 33887                                  scan_ctrlz:
 33888 00005163 57                      	push	di
 33889 00005164 50                      	push	ax
 33890 00005165 06                      	push	es
 33891 00005166 53                      	push	bx
 33892                                  
 33893 00005167 89D7                    	mov	di,dx
 33894 00005169 1E                      	push	ds
 33895 0000516A 07                      	pop	es   			;es:di points at string
 33896                                  
 33897 0000516B 89CB                    	mov	bx,cx			;save current count
 33898                                  
 33899 0000516D B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah	; Ctrl-Z
 33900 0000516F FC                      	cld
 33901 00005170 F2AE                    	repne	scasb			;find first Ctrl-Z
 33902 00005172 7503                    	jnz	short noCtrlZ		;no CtrlZ found in string
 33903                                  
 33904 00005174 29CB                    	sub	bx,cx
 33905 00005176 4B                      	dec	bx			;bx = new count to display
 33906                                  noCtrlZ:
 33907 00005177 89D9                    	mov	cx,bx			;cx = actual display count
 33908                                  
 33909 00005179 5B                      	pop	bx
 33910 0000517A 07                      	pop	es
 33911 0000517B 58                      	pop	ax
 33912 0000517C 5F                      	pop	di
 33913                                  $MIF127:	; 08/04/2023
 33914 0000517D C3                      	retn
 33915                                  
 33916                                  ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 33917                                  ;;
 33918                                  ;;	PROC NAME: $M_DISPLAY_H_STRING
 33919                                  ;;
 33920                                  ;;	FUNCTION:  Will display a string to a specified handle
 33921                                  ;;	INPUTS:    ES:DI points to beginning of message
 33922                                  ;;		   CX contains the number of bytes to write
 33923                                  ;;		   BX contains the handle to write to
 33924                                  ;;	OUPUTS:    None
 33925                                  ;;	REGS USED: AX,DX
 33926                                  ;;
 33927                                  ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 33928                                  
 33929                                  	; 08/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 33930                                  
 33931                                  $M_DISPLAY_H_STRING:
 33932 0000517E 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			;;AN002;; Set number of bytes written to 0
 33933 00005180 09C9                    	or	cx,cx			;;AN002;; For performance, don't write if not necessary
 33934 00005182 74F9                    	jz	short $MIF127
 33935                                  	
 33936 00005184 1E                      	push	ds			;;AN000;;
 33937 00005185 06                      	push	es			;;AN000;;
 33938 00005186 1F                      	pop	ds			;;AN000;; Set DS to segment of message text
 33939                                  	
 33940 00005187 B440                    	mov	ah,40h ; DOS_WRITE_HANDLE ;;AN000;; DOS function to write to a handle
 33941 00005189 89FA                    	mov	dx,di			;;AN000;; Pointer to data to write
 33942                                  
 33943 0000518B 83F901                  	cmp	cx,1 ; $M_SINGLE_CHAR	;;AN000;; Is this a single character?
 33944 0000518E 7528                    	jne	short $MIF128		;;AN000;; No
 33945                                  
 33946 00005190 CD21                    	int	21h			;;AN000;; Write character
 33947                                  		; DOS - 2+ - WRITE TO FILE WITH HANDLE
 33948                                  		; BX = file handle, CX = number of bytes to writ
 33949                                  
 33950 00005192 1F                      	pop	ds			;;AN000;; Set DS to segment of message text
 33951 00005193 50                      	push	ax			;;AN000;;
 33952 00005194 268A05                  	mov	al,[es:di] 		;;AN000;; Get the character
 33953 00005197 E85800                  	CALL    $M_IS_IT_DBCS		;;AN000;; Is this the first byte of a DB character
 33954 0000519A 58                      	pop	ax			;;AN000;;
 33955 0000519B 1E                      	push	ds			;;AN000;;
 33956 0000519C 06                      	push	es			;;AN000;;
 33957 0000519D 1F                      	pop	ds			;;AN000;; Set DS to segment of message text
 33958 0000519E 7306                    	jnc	short $MIF129
 33959                                  	
 33960 000051A0 F8                      	clc				;;AN000;; Clear the DBCS indicator
 33961 000051A1 B440                    	mov	ah,40h ; DOS_WRITE_HANDLE ;;AN000;; DOS function to write to a handle
 33962 000051A3 42                      	inc	dx			;;AN000;; Point to next character
 33963 000051A4 CD21                    	int	21h			;;AN000;; Write character
 33964                                  		; DOS - 2+ - WRITE TO FILE WITH HANDLE
 33965                                  		; BX = file handle, CX = number of bytes to write, 
 33966                                  $MIF129:
 33967                                  ;SR;
 33968                                  ; If the single char happened to be a Ctrl-Z, the dos write would return
 33969                                  ;0 chars written making the caller think there was an error writing. To 
 33970                                  ;avoid this, we check if the single char was a Ctrl-Z and if so, return that
 33971                                  ;the char was written, thus fooling the caller.
 33972                                  
 33973 000051A6 9C                      	pushf				;save flags
 33974 000051A7 26803D1A                	cmp	byte [es:di],1Ah	;is char a Ctrl-Z?
 33975 000051AB 7502                    	jne	short m_popf_j		;no, continue
 33976                                  
 33977 000051AD 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx			;yes, fake as if it was written
 33978                                  m_popf_j:
 33979                                  	; 08/04/2023
 33980                                  	;$M_POPF  ; macro in 'sysmsg.inc' (MSDOS 6.0)
 33981 000051AF EB01                    	jmp	short m_popf		;restore flags
 33982                                  
 33983                                  ; 07/04/2023
 33984                                  ; ---------------------------
 33985                                  ; MSDOS 6.0, SYSMSG.INC, 1991
 33986                                  ; ---------------------------
 33987                                  	; $M_POPF macro
 33988                                  	;jmp	short $+3
 33989                                  intret:
 33990 000051B1 CF                      	iret
 33991                                  m_popf:
 33992 000051B2 0E                      	push	cs
 33993 000051B3 E8FBFF                  	call	intret
 33994                                  	;;; end macro	
 33995                                  ; ---------------------------
 33996                                  
 33997 000051B6 EB18                    	jmp	short $MEN128
 33998                                  
 33999                                  $MIF128:
 34000                                  ;SR;
 34001                                  ; Prescan the string looking for Ctrl-Z. We terminate the message the moment 
 34002                                  ;we hit a Ctrl-Z. cx will contain the number of characters to be printed.
 34003                                  
 34004 000051B8 55                      	push	bp			; M007
 34005 000051B9 51                      	push	cx
 34006 000051BA E8A6FF                  	call	scan_ctrlz		;cx = count without Ctrl-Z
 34007 000051BD 89CD                    	mov	bp,cx			;store no ^Z count in bp ;M007
 34008 000051BF 59                      	pop	cx			;get old count back ;M007
 34009                                  	
 34010 000051C0 CD21                    	int	21h			;;AN000;; Write String at DS:SI to handle
 34011                                  	;jnc	short chk_count		;no error, adjust return count
 34012                                  	;jmp	short m_cnt_ok		;error, return with carry set;M007
 34013                                  	; 08/04/2023
 34014 000051C2 720B                    	jc	short m_cnt_ok 
 34015                                  ;M007
 34016                                  ; If we are writing to con and there is a Ctrl-Z in the string, the
 34017                                  ;return count will be much less and if this returns to the caller we can get
 34018                                  ;spurious error messages. We check here if the count returned is same as
 34019                                  ;original count or same as the count if we stop at Ctrl-Z. In the second
 34020                                  ;case, we fake it as if all bytes have been written. If the return count
 34021                                  ;does not match either count, then we had some other disk error (such as
 34022                                  ;insufficient disk space) and we pass it through
 34023                                  
 34024                                  chk_count:
 34025 000051C4 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax			;have all bytes been written?;M007
 34026 000051C6 7407                    	je	short m_cnt_ok		;there was an error writing ;M007
 34027 000051C8 39C5                    	cmp	bp,ax			;count = Ctrl-Z count? ;M007
 34028 000051CA F8                      	clc				;no error either way ;M007
 34029 000051CB 7502                    	jne	short m_cnt_ok		;no, pass it through ;M007
 34030 000051CD 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx			;return old count ;M007
 34031                                  m_cnt_ok:				; M007
 34032 000051CF 5D                      	pop	bp			; M007
 34033                                  $MEN128:
 34034 000051D0 1F                      	pop	ds			;;AN000;;
 34035                                  ;$MIF127: ; 08/04/2023
 34036 000051D1 C3                      	retn
 34037
