 35433                                  
 35434                                  ;============================================================================
 35435                                  ; LOADHIGH.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 35436                                  ;============================================================================
 35437                                  ; 12/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 35438                                  
 35439                                  ; This is a new module added to support loading programs into UMBs provided
 35440                                  ; by DOS 5.0. 
 35441                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35442                                  ; Usage:
 35443                                  ;
 35444                                  ; LOADHIGH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] <filespec>
 35445                                  ;
 35446                                  ; <filespec> has to be a filename that is not wildcarded.
 35447                                  
 35448                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35449                                  ;
 35450                                  ;	Revision History
 35451                                  ;	================
 35452                                  ;
 35453                                  ;	M009	SR	08/01/90	Set flags to indicate that we are
 35454                                  ;				loading and high and also remember
 35455                                  ;				current UMB state.
 35456                                  ;
 35457                                  ;	M016	SR	08/09/90	Give special error message on attempt
 35458                                  ;				to loadhigh batch files and invalid
 35459                                  ;				filename on Loadhigh command line.
 35460                                  ;
 35461                                  ;	M039	SR	11/19/90	Bug #4270. Copy all the whitespaces
 35462                                  ;				after the program name also as part
 35463                                  ;				of the command line being passed to
 35464                                  ;				the program to be invoked.
 35465                                  ;
 35466                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35467                                  
 35468                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35469                                  ;
 35470                                  ;	include highload.inc		; Grab code for ParseVar and such
 35471                                  
 35472                                  iCmdLine	equ	81h		; PSP:81h points to command-line
 35473                                  
 35474                                  ;
 35475                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35476                                  
 35477                                  ;****	LoadHigh -- Main routine for Loadhigh command
 35478                                  ;
 35479                                  ;	ENTRY	Command line tail is at PSP:iCmdLine terminated by 0dh
 35480                                  ;		CS = DS = SS = TRANGROUP
 35481                                  ;
 35482                                  ;	EXIT	None
 35483                                  ;
 35484                                  ;	USED	ax, bx, cx, dx, si, di, es
 35485                                  ;
 35486                                  ;	ERROR EXITS
 35487                                  ;		Message pointers are setup at the error locations and then
 35488                                  ;	we jump back to CERROR which is the transient error recycle point.
 35489                                  ;	Apart from parse errors, the other errors handled are too many
 35490                                  ;	switches anf invalid filenames.
 35491                                  ;
 35492                                  ;	EFFECTS
 35493                                  ;		The allocation strategy and the state of the arena chain are
 35494                                  ;	put in the requested state according to the given options. If a 
 35495                                  ;	filename is also given, it is executed as well.
 35496                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35497                                  
 35498                                  	; 13/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 35499                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:5927h
 35500                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM only ! (MSDOS 6.0 code is different)
 35501                                  LoadHigh:
 35502 00005648 1E                      	push	ds
 35503 00005649 07                      	pop	es
 35504                                  
 35505 0000564A E86700                  	call	SkipLhDelims
 35506                                  
 35507                                  ;Get command tail to be passed to the program. This includes any whitespace
 35508                                  ;chars between the program name and its parameters as well.
 35509                                  ;On return, ds:si points at the start of the command tail.
 35510                                  
 35511 0000564D 56                      	push	si
 35512 0000564E E81400                  	call	ParseLhCmd
 35513 00005651 5E                      	pop	si
 35514 00005652 720E                    	jc	short LhErr
 35515                                  	
 35516 00005654 E87500                  	call	SetupCmdLine		;setup pgm's command line
 35517                                  
 35518 00005657 E8C800                  	call	SetupPath		;setup path for file
 35519 0000565A 7206                    	jc	short LhErr		;file not found
 35520                                  
 35521                                  ;Set allocation strategy to HighFirst and link in UMBs for exec. This will
 35522                                  ;be reset after return from the Exec
 35523                                  ;We will also set a resident flag to indicate that UMBs were activated for
 35524                                  ;the Exec. On return from the Exec, this flag will be used to deactivate UMBs
 35525                                  
 35526 0000565C E8A600                  	call	HideUMBs		;prepare upper-memory for load
 35527                                  
 35528 0000565F E99DD2                  	jmp	LH_EXECUTE		;go and exec file ;M051
 35529                                  
 35530                                  LhErr:
 35531                                  ;The error message has been setup at this stage
 35532                                  
 35533 00005662 E9EDD2                  	jmp	cerror			;print error message and recycle 
 35534                                  
 35535                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35536                                  					
 35537                                  ;*** 	ParseLhCmd - parses any command-line options
 35538                                  ;
 35539                                  ;	ENTRY	None
 35540                                  ;
 35541                                  ;	EXIT	Carry clear -- command line parsed successfully
 35542                                  ;		Carry set -- appropriate error message setup
 35543                                  ;
 35544                                  ;	USED	ax, si
 35545                                  ;
 35546                                  ;	EFFECTS
 35547                                  ;		Options set up (see highvar.inc)
 35548                                  ;		Filename to be executed setup
 35549                                  ;
 35550                                  ;	ParseLhCmd calls InitVar to initialize data filled in by ParseVar,
 35551                                  ;	then calls ParseVar itself to actually parse the commmand-line.  On
 35552                                  ;	return from ParseVar, DS:SI will point to the beginning of the child
 35553                                  ;	module's name on the command-line; thus it calls LhCopyFilename to
 35554                                  ;	prepare the command-line for that program.
 35555                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35556                                  
 35557                                  	; 13/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 35558                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:5944h
 35559                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM only ! (MSDOS 6.0 code is different)
 35560                                  	; 11/06/2023
 35561                                  ParseLhCmd:
 35562                                  	;mov	si,81h
 35563 00005665 BE8100                  	mov	si,iCmdLine	;ds:si points at command line
 35564                                  
 35565 00005668 C706[DC8A]0000          	mov	word [COMSW],0
 35566 0000566E BF[D085]                	mov	di,Parse_LoadHi
 35567 00005671 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 35568 00005673 E843CB                  	call	Parse_With_Msg
 35569                                  
 35570                                  	; 11/06/2023
 35571                                  	;cmp	ax,0FFFFh ; -1
 35572                                  	;jz	short PLhCmd2
 35573                                  	;cmp	ax,0
 35574                                  	;jnz	short PLhCmd1
 35575                                  	; 11/06/2023
 35576 00005676 40                      	inc	ax ; cmp ax,-1
 35577 00005677 7408                    	jz	short PLhCmd2 ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 35578 00005679 48                      	dec	ax ; cmp ax,0
 35579 0000567A 7504                    	jnz	short PLhCmd1 ; 1 -> 0
 35580                                  	; ax = 0
 35581                                  
 35582 0000567C 89D3                    	mov	bx,dx
 35583                                  	; 14/04/2023
 35584                                  	;call	LhCopyFilename
 35585                                  	;; 13/04/2023
 35586                                  	;;;jc	short PLhCmd2  ; !!! jmp short PLhCmd2 !!!
 35587                                  	;;jmp	short PLhCmd2
 35588                                  	;retn
 35589                                  	; 14/04/2023
 35590 0000567E EB02                    	jmp	short LhCopyFilename
 35591                                  PLhCmd1:
 35592 00005680 F9                      	stc
 35593                                  PLhCmd2:
 35594 00005681 C3                      	retn
 35595                                  
 35596                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35597                                  
 35598                                  	; 13/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 35599                                  
 35600                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35601                                  ; HIGHlOAD.INC, MSDOS 6.0, 1992
 35602                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35603                                  
 35604                                  	; 13/04/2023
 35605                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM only !
 35606                                  	; (Procedure names are not from original Microsoft source code!)
 35607                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:596Ah
 35608                                  ;set_strategy:
 35609                                  	;mov	ax,5800h	; DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY
 35610                                  	;int	21h	; DOS - 3+ - GET/SET MEMORY ALLOCATION STRATEGY
 35611                                  	;		; AL = function code: get allocation strategy
 35612                                  	;mov	bx,ax
 35613                                  	;or	bx,80h
 35614                                  	;mov	ax,5801h	; DOS_SET_STRATEGY
 35615                                  	;int	21h	; DOS - 3+ - GET/SET MEMORY ALLOCATION STRATEGY
 35616                                  	;		; AL = function code: set allocation strategy
 35617                                  	;retn
 35618

 35620                                  ;set_umblink:

 35622                                  	;mov	bx,1
 35623                                  	;int	21h	; DOS - 3+ - GET/SET MEMORY ALLOCATION STRATEGY

 35625                                  	;retn
 35626                                  
 35627                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35628                                  
 35629                                  ;***	LhCopyFilename -- copy filename from command line to buffer
 35630                                  ;
 35631                                  ;	ENTRY	ds:si points at primary argument (filename)
 35632                                  ;
 35633                                  ;	EXIT	Carry set -- filename has wildcards.  In this event, DX will
 35634                                  ;				already contain an appropriate error number.
 35635                                  ;		Carry clear -- filename has been copied as needed; DS:SI
 35636                                  ;				points to first character (most likely space)
 35637                                  ;				after filename.
 35638                                  ;
 35639                                  ;	USED	ax, si
 35640                                  ;
 35641                                  ;	EFFECTS
 35642                                  ;		ExecPath contains the filename
 35643                                  ;
 35644                                  ; If there are any wildcards in the filename, then we have an error
 35645                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35646                                  
 35647                                  	; 13/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 35648                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:5984h
 35649                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM only ! (MSDOS 6.0 code is different)
 35650                                  LhCopyFilename:
 35651 00005682 1E                      	push	ds
 35652 00005683 56                      	push	si
 35653 00005684 57                      	push	di
 35654 00005685 C57704                  	lds	si,[bx+4]
 35655 00005688 BF[ED89]                	mov	di,EXECPATH
 35656                                  lhcpfn1:
 35657 0000568B AC                      	lodsb

 35719                                  ;***	SetupCmdLine -- prepare command line for the program
 35720                                  ;
 35721                                  ;	ENTRY	{es/ds}:si = points just after the end of the child program
 35722                                  ;
 35723                                  ;	EXIT	None
 35724                                  ;
 35725                                  ;	USED
 35726                                  ;
 35727                                  ;	EFFECTS		
 35728                                  ;		The rest of the command line following the pgm name is 
 35729                                  ;	moved to the top of the command line buffer (at TRANGROUP:81h)
 35730                                  ;	and a new command line length is put in
 35731                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35732                                  
 35733                                  	; 14/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 35734                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:59BEh
 35735                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM only ! (MSDOS 6.0 code is different)
 35736                                  SetupCmdLine:
 35737                                  	;mov	di,81h
 35738 000056CC BF8100                  	mov	di,iCmdLine
 35739 000056CF 30C9                    	xor	cl,cl
 35740 000056D1 FEC9                    	dec	cl			;just CR means count = 0
 35741                                  SetCmdL1:

 35743 000056D4 AA                      	stosb
 35744 000056D5 FEC1                    	inc	cl			;update count
 35745                                  	; 14/04/2023

 35748                                  	;jz	short SetCmdL2 ; *
 35749 000056D7 3C0D                    	cmp	al,0Dh			;carriage return?
 35750 000056D9 75F8                    	jnz	short SetCmdL1		;no, continue storing
 35751                                  SetCmdL2:

 35753 000056E0 C3                      	retn

 35832                                  ;***	SetupPath -- Do path search for the file to be executed
 35833                                  ;
 35834                                  ;	ENTRY	None
 35835                                  ;
 35836                                  ;	EXIT	Carry set if file not found or not executable file
 35837                                  ;
 35838                                  ;	EFFECTS
 35839                                  ;		ExecPath contains the full path of the file to be executed
 35840                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35841                                  
 35842                                  	; 14/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 35843                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:5A0Fh
 35844                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM only ! (MSDOS 6.0 code is different)
 35845                                  SetupPath:
 35846                                  
 35847                                  ;Juggle around the argv pointers to make argv[1] into argv[0]. This is 
 35848                                  ;because the path search routine that we are about to invoke expects the
 35849                                  ;filename to search for to be argv[0].
 35850                                  ;
 35851                                  ;If our new argv[0] starts with a switcharacter, it's an option... skip right
 35852                                  ;over it by doing the whole move again (smaller, of course, this time).
 35853                                  
 35854                                  
 35855                                  	;mov	ax,arg.argvcnt		;total number of arguments
 35856                                  	; 14/04/2023
 35857                                  	;mov	ax,[ARG_ARGVCNT]
 35858 00005722 A1[9490]                	mov	ax,[ARG+ARG_UNIT.argvcnt]
 35859                                  
 35860 00005725 48                      	dec	ax			;less one - skip "LoadHigh"
 35861                                  	;mov	bx,SIZE Argv_ele
 35862 00005726 BB0B00                  	mov	bx,ARGV_ELE.SIZE ; 11
 35863                                  	;mov	bx,11
 35864 00005729 F7E3                    	mul	bx			;dx:ax = size of argument lists
 35865                                  
 35866                                  	; 14/04/2023
 35867 0000572B 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax			;size to move
 35868                                  
 35869                                  	;mov	di,offset TRANGROUP:Arg	;Copy TO argv[0]
 35870                                  	;mov	di,ARG_ARGV ;mov di,[ARG+ARG_UNIT.argv] ; mov di,[ARG]
 35871 0000572D BF[D48D]                	mov	di,ARG	
 35872 00005730 89FE                    	mov	si,di			;
 35873                                  	;add	si,SIZE Argv_ele	;Copy FROM argv[1]
 35874 00005732 83C60B                  	add	si,ARGV_ELE.SIZE ; 11
 35875                                  	
 35876                                  	; 14/04/2023
 35877                                  	;mov	cx,ax
 35878                                  
 35879 00005735 FC                      	cld
 35880 00005736 F3A4                    	rep	movsb			;Move the argument list
 35881                                  	
 35882                                  	;dec	arg.argvcnt		;Fake one less argument, and
 35883                                  	;dec	word [ARG_ARGVCNT]
 35884 00005738 FF0E[9490]              	dec	word [ARG+ARG_UNIT.argvcnt]
 35885                                  	
 35886                                  ; Done moving... argv[0] is now the child program's name, and [1] its first arg
 35887                                  
 35888 0000573C E821DA                  	call	path_search		;look in the path
 35889                                  
 35890                                  ;ax = 0, no file found
 35891                                  ;ax < 4, batch file found -- cant be executed
 35892                                  ;ax = 4,8 => .com or .exe file found
 35893                                  
 35894 0000573F 09C0                    	or	ax,ax			;any file found?
 35895 00005741 740B                    	jz	short no_exec_file	;no, error
 35896                                  
 35897 00005743 83F804                  	cmp	ax,4			;executable file?
 35898                                  	;jl	short no_exec_bat	;no, indicate fail ; M016
 35899                                  	;clc
 35900                                  	;retn
 35901                                  	; 14/04/2023
 35902 00005746 7201                    	jb	short no_exec_bat
 35903 00005748 C3                      	retn 
 35904                                  
 35905                                  no_exec_bat:
 35906 00005749 BA[8281]                	mov	dx,NoExecBat_Ptr	;Setup message ptr ; M016
 35907 0000574C EB06                    	jmp	short lhsp_errret	;return error; M016
 35908                                  
 35909                                  no_exec_file:
 35910 0000574E B80200                  	mov	ax,ERROR_FILE_NOT_FOUND ; 2
 35911 00005751 E88DFF                  	call	LhSetupErrMsg		;setup error message
 35912                                  lhsp_errret:				; M016
 35913 00005754 F9                      	stc
 35914 00005755 C3                      	retn

 37685                                  
 37686                                  ;============================================================================
 37687                                  ; TDATA.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 37688                                  ;============================================================================
 37689                                  ; 30/09/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37690                                  
 37691                                  ; TITLE	COMMAND Transient Initialized DATA
 37692                                  
 37693                                  ;The TRANDATA segment contains data that is assumed to have predefined
 37694                                  ;initial values at the beginning of each command cycle. It is
 37695                                  ;included in the transient checksum area. If values in TRANDATA
 37696                                  ;change, the transient will be reloaded for the next command cycle.
 37697                                  
 37698                                  align 16
 37699                                  		; MSDOS 3.3 COMMAND.COM (1987) Transient portion offset 3730h
 37700                                  
 37701                                  PRINTF_TABLE:	db '0123456789ABCDEF'
 37702                                  _3740h:		db '%S',0
 37703                                  ARG_BUF_PTR:	dw _3740h
 37704                                  		dw _3747h
 37705                                  _3747h:		dw ARG_BUF ; _43E8h
 37706                                  _3749h:		db '%S ',0
 37707                                  STRINGBUF1PTR:	dw _3749h
 37708                                  		dw STRING_PTR_1 ; _4468h
 37709                                  _3751h:		db '%9ld',0
 37710                                  FSIZEMESPTR:	dw _3751h
 37711                                  		dw FILESIZE_L ; _446Ah
 37712                                  		dw FILESIZE_H ; _446Ch
 37713                                  _375Ch:		db '%S',0
 37714                                  STRINGBUF2PTR:	dw _375Ch
 37715                                  		dw STRING_PTR_2 ; _446Eh
 37716                                  _3763h:		db 9,0
 37717                                  TABPTR:		dw _3763h
 37718                                  _3767h:		db 0Dh,0Ah
 37719                                  		db 'Batch file missing',0Dh,0Ah,0
 37720                                  BADPATHPTR:	dw _3767h
 37721                                  _3780h:		db 0Dh,0Ah
 37722                                  		db 'Insert disk with batch file',0Dh,0Ah
 37723                                  		db 'and press any key when ready',0Dh,0Ah,0
 37724                                  INSERTDSKPTR:	dw _3780h
 37725                                  _37C0h:		db 'Bad command or file name',0Dh,0Ah,0
 37726                                  BADNAMPTR:	dw _37C0h
 37727                                  _37DDh:		db 'Duplicate file name or File not found',0Dh,0Ah,0
 37728                                  RENERRPTR:	dw _37DDh
 37729                                  _3807h:		db 'File not found',0Dh,0Ah,0
 37730                                  FNOTFOUNDPTR:	dw _3807h
 37731                                  _381Ah:		db 'Path not found',0Dh,0Ah,0
 37732                                  PNOTFOUNDPTR:	dw _381Ah
 37733                                  _382Dh:		db 'Access denied',0Dh,0Ah,0
 37734                                  ACCDENPTR:	dw _382Dh

 38669                                  ; PARSE BLOCK FOR DIR
 38670                                  
 38671                                  ; The following parse control block is used for the DIR internal command.
 38672                                  ; This command has one optional file specification and several optional
 38673                                  ; switches. Switches, switch values, and the filespec are returned in 
 38674                                  ; PARSE1_OUTPUT.
 38675                                  ;
 38676                                  ; Switches are /a[value], /-a, /o[value], /-o, /s, /-s, /?, /b, /-b,
 38677                                  ; /w, /-w, /p, and /-p. The string values for /a and /o are optional,
 38678                                  ; do not require colons, and are not checked against a value list.
 38679                                  ;
 38680                                  ; Switch /h has been removed from the DIR command	;M008
 38681                                  ; Switch /? is no longer handled internally		;M008
 38682                                  ;
 38683                                  ; A list of pointers to all the switch synonyms is provided here to
 38684                                  ; help identify which switch has been matched.
 38685                                  
 38686                                  	; 15/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 COMMAND.COM
 38687                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:8815h
 38688

 39067                                  ;============================================================================
 39068                                  ; 29/09/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39069                                  
 39070                                  ;TITLE	COMMAND Transient Uninitialized DATA
 39071                                  
 39072                                  ;The TRANSPACE segment contains variable data that is considered
 39073                                  ;volatile between command cycles, and therefore is not included in the
 39074                                  ;transient checksum area. Contents of these variables MUST be
 39075                                  ;initialized before use, and must not be relied upon from command
 39076                                  ;cycle to command cycle.
 39077                                  ;
 39078                                  ;No constant data values should be stored here.
 39079                                  
 39080                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39081                                  ; START OF UNITIALIZED DATA
 39082                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39083                                  
 39084                                  ;	times 12 db 0
 39085                                  
 39086                                  align 16
 39087                                  
 39088                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 COMMAND.COM (1987) Transient portion offset 3F50h
 39089                                  
 39090                                  PRINTF_LEFT:	db 0
 39091                                  PRINTF_LONG:	db 0
 39092                                  PRINTF_HEX:	db 0
 39093                                  TABLE_INDEX:	db 0
 39094                                  PRINTF_WIDTH:	dw 0
 39095                                  PRINTF_BASE:	dw 0
 39096                                  PAD_CHAR:	db 0
 39097                                  PRINTF_HANDLE:	dw 0
 39098                                  PRINTF_BUF: times 100 db 0
 39099                                  PRINTF_BUF_END: ; 30/09/2018
 39100                                  
 39101                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 COMMAND.COM (1987) Transient portion offset 3FBFh
 39102                                  
 39103                                  SRCXNAME: times	DIRSTRLEN+20 db 0 ; 87	; buffer for name translate
 39104                                  TRGXNAME: times	DIRSTRLEN+20 db 0 ; 87	; buffer for name translate
 39105                                  UCOMBUF:  times COMBUFLEN+3  db 0 ; 131	; Raw console buffer
 39106                                  COMBUF:	  times COMBUFLEN+3  db 0 ; 131	; Cooked console buffer
 39107                                  USERDIR1: times	DIRSTRLEN+3  db 0 ; 70  ; Storage for users current directory
 39108                                  EXECPATH: times COMBUFLEN+3  db 0 ; 131 ; Path for external command
 39109                                  RE_INSTR: times DIRSTRLEN+16 db 0 ; 83  ; path for input to redirection
 39110                                  
 39111                                  ; Variables passed up from resident	; in the Resident portion: (initial values)	
 39112                                  HEADCALL:	dw 0			; TRANVARS  (dw THEADFIX)
 39113                                  RESSEG:		dw 0			; MYSEG     (dw 0) 	 	
 39114                                  TPA:		dw 0			; LTPA	    (dw 0)

 39455                                  ;TITLE	COMMAND Transient Uninitialized DATA
 39456                                  
 39457                                  ;The TRANSPACE segment contains variable data that is considered
 39458                                  ;volatile between command cycles, and therefore is not included in the
 39459                                  ;transient checksum area. Contents of these variables MUST be
 39460                                  ;initialized before use, and must not be relied upon from command
 39461                                  ;cycle to command cycle.
